loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
For the last ten years, Amancia has operated her small business in Dumanjug, a region in South Cebu. She raises pigs to sell to customers in her community.

Amancia also has a second business selling homemade meals. This business provides a supplemental income that Amancia needs to support her family which compose of five children. Some of her children are already adults. Amancia has asked for a loan from CEVI to buy piglets, feed and pay for tuition fees. Amancia is 48 years old, and two of her children, are currently studying in school. She aimed to make her family's life easier as a result of her successful business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Catalina has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is maize farmer from Marmara village. As a member of Babban Gona, Rhoda is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rhoda would have had to sell her maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rhoda can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Rhoda is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Mrs. Huyen is a hard working woman, 42 years old. She is married and has two children. Her income is mainly from a small business. With more than 15 years experiences and has support from her husband, her income is able to repay the loan monthly as requested. She wants to improve the living standard for her family and she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three kids, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mariam operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 50 years old. She is married with four children. She has had a posho mill business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to purchase two sacks of maize so that she can grind for her clients.

The profit she will get from her business will help her to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be stable financially and educate her children well.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of maize  so that she can grind for her clients.

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Concordia has been in this business for 5 years. Concordia earns more income from pig fattening.

Concordia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
JACKSON who is in his early 20s is single with no children. He has been running a gengeduka for three years now. He works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start the duka, increased on the genge and hand has paid back all his loans successfully. He is so happy with the loan. He used the profit to take care of himself, his parents, to repay loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka store. He dreams of building his own house.

Jackson will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka store.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Hajara is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when her can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Hajara now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 22-year-old university student majoring in Geology.‎ He has two siblings and his father is retired, so his pension in not enough to cover the household expense ‎and also Khaled`s fees.‎

He needs finances to pay his tuition fees, so he would like to get a loan. With the loan, Khaled will be able ‎to have enough finances to pay his tuition fees for a bachelor’s degree successfully. His plans after ‎graduation are to find a work and to save money to guarantee his future.‎

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees for a BSc. in Geology

loans.name: Silvera

texts.en: Silvera is a 38-year-old, married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari (convenience) store for 15 years. This is the source of her income. Silvera is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store like sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner,  canned food, biscuits, liquor and soft drinks. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. Silvera dreams of making her business a success in the future, and selling merchandise that she does not previously carry to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy sachet items of milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner,  canned food, biscuits, liquor and soft drinks

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs.Thuy is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Her family’s income is mainly from small business . She is interested to improve the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Al Amal 4 Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the featured borrower for Al Amal 4 Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zainab is a 24-year-old married mother of two. Two years ago, she started working as a teacher to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a good teacher who is loved by her students. Zainab is working hard to improve her family's living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house to make it a better place for her family. Zainab is the lady sitting in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Diala is the first lady on the right, and Darine is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house to make it a better place for her family

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 41-year-old married father of five children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Fifteen years ago, he started working in the agricultural field to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He gained experience in this domain from his brother who has Agronomy certificate.

Wissam is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to apply an irrigation network which will increase his production.
Wissam hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to install an irrigation network to increase his production.

loans.name: Rabeka

texts.en:
Rabeka is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Rabeka has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rabeka would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Rabeka can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Rabeka will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Rabeka is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 68-year-old widow who runs a small business raising pigs. She lives in the Southwest region in Cebu, in the town of Moalboal. Francisca has raised pigs in this area for fifteen years.

Francisca has requested a loan from CEVI to buy piglets and feed. This investment will help her to ensure continuous supply of feed to fatten her hogs and increase her piglets to raise on-time. With this, she can anticipate an increase in her profits. Francisca's income will pay for her food and other household expenses.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a 33 year old married woman living with her husband and mother of two children. Her husband is the main income source in the family, and she is a housewife taking care of her family. Due to the hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her children school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure them a happy life.

loans.use: to pay her children's school educational fees.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 46 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He has a retail shop and also does dairy farming. He has been in the business for 27 years.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and will use the loan to buy a chaff cutter to grind nappier grass for the cows and get more milk for sell. He will use the generated profits to add more dairy cows. His future hopes and dreams are to buy more dairy cows and get more milk per day for sell.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter to grind nappier grass for the cows and get more milk for sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halimeh is 54 years old lives, in Baqaa, a married woman and she has three children.‎
She is seeking a loan for her son Abdalla who is appears in the photo instead of Halimeh, as she is ‎conservative woman. He is 20 years old, is a student in the university and majoring in Computer ‎Science.

She is facing some problems in covering the university fees due to the weak economic ‎situation for the family but she want to see him to become a very successful man in the future. Halimeh wants to see her son ‎achieve all his dreams, therefore she decided to help him, so she applied for a loan to cover the semester fees.

One day he can get a good job and be a good man.‎

loans.use: to pay the university fees for her son, for a BSc. in Computer Science

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 25 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos, su deseo es mejorar las ventas de sus negocios ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea satisfacer a una mayor demanda. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de artículos de tienda golosinas, cereales, bebidas, sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, pan dulce, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Rosa, 45, lives in her own house with her husband. She has had a small shop in her place of residence for 25 years; she has many customers due to the variety of products. Her desire is to improve sales at her business, since it is her main source of income and she wishes to meet increased demand. For these reasons she has decided to apply for this loan from Integral to invest in the purchase of store items such as candy, cereals, beverages, soups, eggs, staple foods, soft drinks, pastries, etc. and thus have a better income.

loans.use: buy store items such as candy, cereals, beverages, soups, eggs, staple foods, soft drinks, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Isleem

texts.en:
Isleem is a single guy who lives with his parents. He runs a sheep farm in Khanyounes in the Gaza Strip. The farm is next to his parents' house. He works alone on the farm. Isleem has been in this business for three years. He sells all sheep products and also sells the sheep themselves.

Isleem started the business with only four sheep and now he has 12 sheep. The farm is the only source of income for Isleem and his family.

Isleem says that the challenge for his business is the political situation, as there are no certainties in Gaza. The other challenge is the competition in the market.

He requested the loan to buy new sheep for the farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Isleem would like to expand his business and sell additional livestock on his farm.

loans.use: to buy new sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Julia Magdalena

texts.es: Julia es una emprendedora mujer que reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y decidió hace cinco años darle un nuevo rol a su vida a través del comercio de productos reconocidos en Colombia y muchos de ellos en otras naciones del mundo. Julia recibió una invitación de una consultora amiga quien le propuso vincularse a una empresa multinivel y al poco tiempo empezó a obtener excelentes resultados.  Diariamente promociona el catálogo a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares que están fidelizados con esta marca y a todos aquellos que aún no, les dedica un espacio para obsequiarles muestras de productos o demostraciones con exfoliantes, cremas cosméticas, maquillajes, entre otros. En la actualidad desea invertir en un mayor surtido productos, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en perfumes, cremas, colonias, y productos capilares que son de gran rotación y solicitud de sus clientes.  Con esta inversión podrá ampliar su oferta de productos y así acercarse a la meta de remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julia is an enterprising woman who resides in a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla and decided five years ago to give a new role to her life through the sales of products recognized in Colombia and many of them in other nations of the world. Julia received an invitation from a friend who is a consultant, who proposed that she link herself to a multilevel company, and she soon began to obtain excellent results.

Every day she promotes the catalogue to her neighbors, friends, and family members who are loyal to this brand as well as to those who are not yet. She devotes a space to gift them with product samples or demonstrations with exfoliants, cosmetic creams, makeup, among other items. She currently wishes to invest in a wider range of products.

For this reason she is applying for her Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation], which she will invest in perfumes, lotions, colognes, and hair products that sell quickly and are in great demand among her clients. With this investment she will be able to expand her product offering and thus get closer to her goal of remodeling her house.

loans.use: invest in perfumes, lotions, colognes, and hair products that sell quickly and are in great demand among her clients.

loans.name: Israël

texts.fr: Israël, 38 ans, est marié et père de deux enfants. Pour nourrir sa famille et assurer la scolarisation des enfants, il a emménagé une petite boutique de revente de boissons gazeuses à son domicile. Sa boutique est très achalandée et jouit d’une bonne réputation dans le quartier. Ses produits se vendant très vite, il cherche un appui financier pour éviter une rupture de stock.
texts.en:
Israël is thirty-eight years old, married and father to two children. To feed his family and pay for the education of his children, he sells soft drinks from a small shop in his home.

His shop is heavily frequented and has a good reputation in the area. He sells his stock very quickly so has requested this loan to avoid running out of supplies.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Marie Raymonde

texts.fr: Raymonde a 33 ans. Elle mariée et elle a un enfant. Elle vend des produits alimentaires à domicile et elle souhaite avoir les moyens nécessaires pour offrir une meilleure condition de vie à sa famille. Elle travaille sans relâche à développer son petit commerce. Aujourd’hui, elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Raymonde is thirty-three years old, married and has one child. She sells food products from her home.

Raymonde would like to be able to offer her family a better standard of living so she works constantly to improve her business. She is requesting this loan so she can build up her stock levels.

loans.use: to buy boxes of concentrated milk and yellow sugar.

loans.name: Mirlande

texts.fr: Mirlande a 41 ans et vit avec son mari et ses quatre enfants à Damien. Elle vend des produits alimentaires depuis plus de dix ans. Aujourd'hui, elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter stock et gagner des revenus plus élevés. À l'avenir, elle espère épargner davantage.
texts.en:
Mirlande is forty-one years old and lives with her husband Damien, and their four children. She has been selling food products for more than ten years.

Mirlande has requested this loan to increase her stock levels and improve her sales revenue. In the future, she would like to be able to save more.

loans.use: to buy boxes of eggs and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Marie Claude

texts.fr: Marie-Claude a 44 ans et elle vit en union libre. Elle a quatre enfants et elle possède une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des produits alimentaires, de la lessive et divers produits. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock et le diversifier en y ajoutant des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Marie-Claude is forty-four years old, lives with her partner and has four children. She owns and runs a shop selling food products, washing powder and various other products.

Marie-Claude has requested this loan to increase her stock levels and expand the range of products she offers to include cosmetic products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is an 18-year-old single guy who lives with his parents. He runs a sheep farm in Deir Al-Balah in the Gaza Strip. The farm is next to his parents' house. He works alone on the farm. Mahmoud has been in this business for three years. He sells all sheep products and also sells the sheep themselves.

Mahmoud started the business with only four sheep and now he has 12 sheep. The farm is the only source of income for Mahmoud and his family.

Mahmoud says that the challenge for his business is the political situation as there are no certainties in Gaza. The other challenge is the competition in the market.

He requested the loan to buy new sheep for the farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Mahmoud would like to expand his business and sell additional livestock on his farm.

loans.use: to buy new sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco

La socia es la Sra. Pilar ,la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que mediante a su negocio la socia espera poder obtener más ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia continua vendiendo  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, leche, aceite entre otros.
Las socias que están  pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the communal bank "LAS AMISTOSAS". The bank is in the Urcos district, part of Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

This member is Ms Pilar, who continues working at her business, a grocery store and restaurant. She has been running her business for years and it has been going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. She is a hard-working woman who, through her business, hopes to be able to earn more money in order to continue supporting her family. She continues to sell basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits in order to provide for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, milk, oil, etc.

The photos of members added to the group photo were taken after the meeting, as they asked permission for work reasons.

All members thank those who are involved in making this dream come true, and commit to making their payments at the intervals that have been set.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is 44 years old, married and blessed with one child. He does a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for five years. He is also a poultry farmer.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income. He will use the profits to educate his child.

His future hopes and dreams are to own a fleet of vehicles and invest in real estate.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 40 years old, married and blessed with four children. She sells household goods and has been in the business for three years. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the loan to buy stock of buckets and basins to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children and also increase her savings. Her future hopes and dreams are to have a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy stock of buckets and basins to sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Vernelia

texts.fr: Vernelia, 48 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a quatre enfants. Pour gagner des revenus, elle revend des chaussures et vêtements usagés. Elle étale ses marchandises à coté de sa maison. Ainsi, elle peut s’occuper de certaines taches ménagères en gérant son activité. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Vernelia is forty-eight years old, lives with her partner and has four children. To earn a living, she sells second-hand clothing and shoes from the area next to her house. In this way she can also take care of the home while she works.

Vernelia has requested this loan to increase her stock levels.

loans.use: to buy second hand shoes for sale.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Marié et père de trois enfants, Koffi est un homme âgé de 37 ans qui vit à Adidogomé où il exerce son métier de menuisier. Koffi fabrique des bancs et des chaises pour vendre et réaliser son bénéfice par le revenu tiré de son activité. Koffi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Koffi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des planches afin d’en fabriquer plus de bancs et de chaises puis de mieux revendre et répondre aux attentes de ses clients et réaliser plus de bénéfice pour parvenir à bien supporté les dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi is thirty-seven years old, married and father to three children. He lives in Adidogomé where he works as a furniture maker. He makes and sells benches and chairs. Twice a month, Koffi buys new supplies from the market.

Koffi is requesting this loan to order planks of wood to make more benches and chairs. This will help him meet the needs of his customers and increase his sales level. His higher earnings will pay for the expenses of his family.

loans.use: to buy 23 planks of wood for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Grupo Las Hermanas Panquiney Group

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer soltera de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su madre en una comunidad denominada aldea guineales.
Marta con el afán de salir adelante con su madre, ha trabajado desde hace 4 años elaborando güipiles típicos de su región, a ella le encanta esta actividad pues lo genera desde la comodidad de su hogar y esto le permite realizar otras actividades. Gracias a sus aspiraciones en la vida, es la representante del grupo las hermanas panquiney, pues ella con el deseo de mejorar sus tejidos ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la como de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos. Sus aspiraciones en la vida son: conseguir el fortalecimiento de su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marta is a single woman aged 25 years. She lives with her mother in a community called Aldea Guineales.

To support herself and her mother, Marta has worked making güipiles (traditional tunics typical of her region) for four years. She loves doing this, as it can be done from the comfort of home, which enables her to do other things. Due to her life goals, she has become the representative of the group Las Hermanas Panquiney. She wants to improve her knitwear, so she has decided to request a loan to buy different colours and types of wool. 

Her aim in life is to strengthen her business in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different colours and types of wool for making traditional tunics.

loans.name: Gylène

texts.fr: Gylène a 38 ans et elle vit avec son mari et son enfant à Canaan. Elle gère une boutique tout près de sa maison où elle vend des produits alimentaires. Gylène demande un microcrédit pour acheter de nouveaux produits. À l’avenir, elle espère attirer plus de clients et gagner des revenus plus élevés.
texts.en:
Gylène is thirty-eight years old and lives with her husband and their child in Canaan. She runs a shop near her home where she sells food products.

Gylène has requested this loan to buy new products for sale. In the future, she hopes to attract more customers and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and crates of bottled juice.

loans.name: Josselyn Carolina

texts.es:
Josselyn, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado en un ingenio azucarero, tienen 1 hijo que está pequeñp.

Josselyn, tiene una tienda en su casa desde hace 8 meses, en donde ofrece sus productos a las personas del cantón y decidió colocar este negocio para obtener ingresos mientras cuida a su hijo y hace los oficios de su casa; anteriormente ella estaba empleada en una comercial, pero el cuido de su embarazo y de su bebe le impidieron seguir con ese trabajo.

Josselyn, necesita el préstamo para comprar jabón, arroz, aceite, golosinas, etc. porque estos son los productos que más buscan sus clientes.

Josselyn, sueña con hacer crecer su tienda y que ésta funcione por muchos años más, para poder ayudarle a su hijo para que estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Josselyn is 22 years old and she completed secondary school. She has a partner who is employed in a sugar mill and they have a young son.

Josselyn has had a shop at home for 8 months, where she offers her products to the people living in the group of houses around her. She decided to start this business to earn some income while taking care of her son and doing the household. Previously she was employed by a trading company, but her pregnancy and the care for her son prevented her to continue with this job.

Josselyn needs the loan to buy soap, rice, oil, candies, etc, because those are the products most requested by her customers. Josselyn dreams to grow her shop and to have it running during many more years, so that she can help her son to study and to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, oil, candies, etc.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Madeleine a 36 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari vend du café et des beignets. Le couple a cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés dans un établissement public (19-15-13-10-7 ans) ; l’ainée de 19 ans  a ouvert un taxi phone et apporte des appuis financiers à la famille en cas de besoin.
Elle vivait en milieu rural, elle est venue vivre en milieu urbain dans l’objectif de développer des activités génératrices de revenus : vente de fruits de saison. Elle a choisi les bananes en raison de l’existence d’un marché sûr et de la rentabilité de l’activité .Au début, elle achète les  bananes mûres pour les revendre (2013 à 2015). Depuis 2015, toujours dans l’objectif d’améliorer la rentabilité de l’activité, elle s’approvisionne  en bananes vertes  pour les mûrir. Elle vend directement les bananes mûres auprès des consommateurs tout en approvisionnant les revendeurs. 
La famille vit dans une maison en bois louée qui est l’une des  causes de maladies fréquentes frappant le ménage. L’acquisition d’un terrain et la construction d’une  maison constitue un projet
texts.en:
Madeleine is thirty-six years old, married and has five children. Her husband sells coffee and doughnuts. The children are nineteen, fifteen, thirteen, ten and seven years old and four of them attend a public school. The nineteen-year-old runs a taxi phone (a stall where you can make telephone calls) and contributes to the family's income when necessary.

Madeleine used to live in the countryside but moved to town to take advantage of the better opportunities to sell seasonal fruits. She sells bananas because the market for them is stable and profitable. At first, she bought and sold ripe bananas (from 2013 to 2015). Since 2015, in order to increase profitability, she buys green bananas and ripens them before sale. She sells directly to the general public but also to other retailers.

Madeleine's family live in a rented, wooden house which results in a lot of illness for them. In the future, she would like to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy bananas for sale.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверо детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Саодат живёт в сельской местности. Сама Саодат занимается куплей продажей посуды на местном рынке.  А муж Саодат работает на стройке разнорабочим. Они очень любят своих детей, и стараются обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что они желают видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую они получают, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье. 
 В данное время Саодат вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Саодат обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Saodat is a responsible woman with a positive attitude towards life.  She is 45, married, and the mother of four children.  She lives in a rural area with her family.  She buys and sells kitchen utensils at the local market.  Her husband works as a laborer on a construction site.  Both Saodat and her husband love their children very much and they would do anything to give them a good education and see them become well-educated people.  However their earnings are not sufficient to cover all the family's needs.

At the moment, Saodat and her husband want to renovate their house and improve their living conditions, but they don't have the personal means to do so.  For this reason, Saodat has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and requested a loan to buy building materials to renovate her house.  She is looking forward to a positive outcome, and she thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилчон мужчина среднего возраста в самом рассвете сил. Он любящий муж и заботливый отец. Комилчон со своей супругой растет четверых детей. Он работает водителем микроавтобуса. Комилчон с раннего утра до позднего вечера работает не покладая рук, чтобы его дети имели все необходимое. Упорный труд и работа дали о себе знать. Его микроавтобус сломался и нуждается в починке. Комилчон обратился за помощью к кредиторам KIVA за поддержкой надеясь, что его поддержат в этой ситуации.
texts.en: Komiljon is a middle-aged man with great physical strength.  He is a devoted husband and a caring father.  He and his wife are raising four children.  Komiljon works as a van driver.  He works tirelessly from early morning until late at night in order to provide his children with all the necessities of life.  However, he's now paying for his hard work and labor, as his van broke down and needs to be repaired.  Komiljon has turned to Kiva lenders to receive some support, and he is hoping to get through this difficult situation thanks to your help.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his van.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una joven socia que tiene 25 años y un hijo por quien trabajar, por esa razón ella se dedica la venta de artesanía  Y granos secos, para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. 
La socia pertenece al Banco "Virgen asunta", ella trabaja muy duro y los fines de semana se dedica a una feria muy popular en el Cusco,  Luz solicito el préstamo para comprar chompas, chalinas, guantes y chullos. Para poder venderlos ya que son productos de temporada en la región.
La socia se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas y está muy agradecía con los inversionistas de kiva que le dan la oportunidad de seguir ampliando su negocio, lo cual viene hacer su deseo y meta de la socia
texts.en:
Luz is a young member, 25-years old and has a son who is the reason why she works selling crafts and dried beans, in order to support her son. She belongs to the "Virgen Asunta" loan group. She works very hard and on the weekends she works in a very popular market in Cuzco.

Luz is requesting a loan to buy sweaters, scarves, gloves and woolen hats in order to sell them because they are seasonal products in the region. She promises to pay her agreed fees and is very thankful for the Kiva investors who give her the opportunity to keep expanding her business, which has become her desire and goal.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, scarves, gloves and woolen hats.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella sigue dedicándose a vender frutas en el mercado. 
La socia desea ampliar su negocio para tener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. María solicito el préstamo para comprar manzanas, plátano, sandia y naranjas.
Maria está muy contenta por el préstamo, ya que le ayudara mucho para conseguir sus metas, y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ella. Por eso se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en: María is an entrepreneurial and hard-working member who supports her family. She continues working to sell fruits in the market. She wants to expand her business to have more income and improve her quality of life. María is asking for a loan to buy apples, bananas, watermelons and oranges. She is very happy for the loan because it will help her a lot to achieve her goals. She thanks the Kiva investors for believing in her. For that reason, she promises to pay back her agreed fees.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, watermelon and oranges.

loans.name: Hushnudjon

texts.ru: Хушнудчон добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 27 лет. Он женат и  имеет двое детей. Хушнудчон живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он занимается своим бизнесом. Хушнудчон занимается деканством и животноводством. Так же он работает столяром. Его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Хушнудчон хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Хушнудчон заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Hushnudjon is a kind-hearted man with a positive attitude towards life.  He is 27, married, and the father of two children.  He lives with his family in a small house in the countryside.  In order to support his family, he has his own business; he is involved in farming and animal husbandry and he also works as a carpenter.  His wife helps him to take care and to raise the livestock.  His animal husbandry business brings him a good income, so for this reason, he would like to expand his activity and increase his livestock headcount.  He has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and requested a loan to buy some livestock.  He thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Souheer

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Souheer is 29 years old, married with 3 kids, and lives in Yabad in Jenin City. Souheer has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep and ewes. Souheer needs this loan to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell them to make a profit. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand her business, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Souheer hopes to expand her business by increasing the number of livestock.

Souheer thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes to raise them and sell them to make a profit.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 49-year-old married mother of four. Almost a year ago, she started selling home products to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Noura hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' special requests.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 45 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He has a retail shop and has been in the business for 13 years. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he will use the loan to buy bread, milk, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice and maize flour to sell.  He will use the anticipated profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business, make more income and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a 52-year-old fish monger at Mariakani, Kenya. She is a mother of four who has been in this business for the last four years and is doing very well with a good income.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business after repaying her previous loans successfully.

She will use the money to purchase sacks of dry fish for resale and the anticipated profits to expand her fish business to other towns.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dry fish

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Lastrabajadoras Group

texts.es: Antonia (la primera del lado derecho en la fotografía)  es una mujer de 38 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia con la que vive, ella cuenta que con su crédito pudo realizar la inversión en su negocio de ropa típica y a sus clientes pudo satisfacer mejor, a Dios gracias sus ingresos mejoraron con este avance ella está contenta más no conforme, pues la época de fin de año ya se está acercando por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de mucho mas mercaderías tales como; fajas cortes y güipiles, esto con el afán de poder aprovechar mejor esta época. Su gran sueño es contar con un local propio para exhibir mejor su producto.
texts.en: Antonia (the first on the right in the photo) is a 38-year old woman. She is married and has a lovely family that she lives with. She says that with her previous loan, she was able to invest in her traditional clothing business and her customers were more satisfied. Thankfully, her income improved and she is happy with this progress but she is not satisfied. The end of the year is coming up and for that reason she is requesting a loan to buy much more merchandise such as: belts, traditional skirts and traditional woven blouses. She hopes to be able to take advantage of this season. Her great dream is to have her own store to better showcase her product.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as belts, traditional skirts and traditional woven blouses.

loans.name: Afia  Woe  Christine

texts.fr: Afia est une femme mariée qui vit avec trois enfants à charge. Résidant à Adidogomé, Afia est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant .Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Afia sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités d’habits en vue de bien revendre et de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en: Afia is a married woman with three dependent children.  She lives in Adidogomé and resells second-hand clothes.  She stocks up once a month at the market and resells her merchandise as an itinerant seller in the surrounding neighborhoods.  She is taking this loan in order to get a large stock of merchandise, maximize her profits and meet her customers' expectations.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase some bags of clothes and increase her sales and profits.  This will in turn allow her to help her husband take care of the various day-to-day expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy 300 clothing items.

loans.name: Aminada

texts.fr: Aminada a 33 ans, elle est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfant. Elle vit avec ses parents et elle revend des vêtements et des sous-vêtements d’occasion. Elle s’approvisionne chez des commerçants qui importent beaucoup de marchandises d’occasion des États-Unis. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Aminada is 33, single, without any children.  She lives with her parents and resells second-hand clothes and underwear.  She stocks up from merchants who import large quantities of second-hand goods from the United States. She is taking this micro-loan to boost her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Ahmad is 26 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Yata in Hebron City. Ahmad has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep and ewes. Ahmad needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell and to make a profit. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits his ability to expand his business, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Ahmad hopes to expand his business by increasing the number of livestock.

Ahmad thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell them to make a profit.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es una socia que se dedica a vender granos secos y verduras en el mercado de su localidad ,ubicado a cercanías de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia tiene 33 años y saca adelante a sus dos hijos, su deseo es ampliar su negocio de venta de granos secos, por eso solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz, fréjol y lentejas.
La socia pertenece al banco “virgen Asunta” y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas y está muy agradecía con los inversionistas de KIVA que le dan la oportunidad de seguir adelante y cumplir su deseo.
la socia al momento de sacarle la fotografía cerro los ojos.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member who works selling dried beans and vegetables in the area market, located in the outskirts of the city of Cuzco. She is 33-years old and supports her two children. Her wish is to expand her business selling dried beans. For that reason she is requesting a loan to buy corn, beans, and lentils. She belongs to the "Virgen Asunta" bank and promises to pay back her agreed dues. She is very thankful for the Kiva investors who give her the opportunity to keep going and achieve her wish.

(The moment the picture was taken, she closed her eyes.)

loans.use: to buy corn, beans and lentils.

loans.name: Chimera

texts.en:
Chimera is 39 year old and has been selling household goods for the last 4 years. He is married and blessed with 4 children.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this loan to purchase plastic cups, plates and carrying bags and hopes this will enable him to obtain more income to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. In the future he hopes to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase plastic cups, plates and carrying bags and hopes this will enable him to obtain more income to support his family.

loans.name: Phestus

texts.en:
Phestus is 41 years old and has been a livestock farmer for the past six years. He is married and blessed with six children.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he will use the loan to buy goats for resale. Phestus hopes this will enable him to get more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He hopes to have a successful business and educated children in the future.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth was able to finish construction project of building a town house through the help of KIVA's loan. It has increased her income which allowed her to build a general store as shown in this photo.

She is again humbly asking for a PHP 30,000 loan to buy and fill her store with grocery items like rice, canned goods, instant noodles, beverages, cooking oil, eggs, breads and coffee.

Her earnings from her construction project and store have definitely sustained her family's basic needs. That is why she is grateful for KIVA and its lenders for their generosity and concern to small businesswomen like her.

Elizabeth's simple dream is to sustain and grow her business so she can send her children to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for grocery items and beverages to sell at her small general store.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 58 years old and has seven children. Riza is married and has two children who are still in school.

Riza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Riza requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Riza has been in pig fattening for five years now, and she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old, is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, cereal and coffee to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosalinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, cereals and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusif has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yusif can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yusif will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Yusif is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Ibraheem is 28 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Yata in Hebron City. Ibraheem has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep and ewes. Ibraheem needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell to make a profit. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits his ability to expand his business, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Ibraheem hopes to expand his business by increasing the number of livestock.

Ibraheem thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy sheep and ewes to raise and sell to make a profit.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 36 years old and has a tailoring business. She is married and blessed with two children. She makes school and corporate uniforms, and the business has been profitable.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she will use the loan to purchase assorted sewing threads and plain clothes for making uniforms and to serve more customers so that she can get more income to support her family. She will use the generated profits to educate her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, become successful, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted sewing threads and plain clothes for making uniforms and to serve more customers.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She is 48 years old and from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Manuel, her business partner, she has children, one of whom is a high school student. The couple does their best to send their child to school and to give their child the chance to go to college. They believe education is a tool for uplifting their lives.

Salvacion has been in the fruit retailing business for four years already. Her husband picks up several kilos of fruits from farm owners and wholesalers so that Salvacion can arrange and display the fruits at her stand. Her stand is located in a populated area along the road, and her charming personality draws people to buy at her stand.

To sustain and grow her business, she would like to request a 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy several kilos of bananas, mangoes, oranges, lanzones, and apples to sell at her fruit stand. She trusts you will consider her request. Her earnings will cover their daily needs and the schooling of her child.

Salvacion hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She desires for her child to go to college, allowing her a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fruits such as bananas, mangoes, oranges, lanzones, and apples to sell at her fruit stand.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Evangeline is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evangeline has been raising livestock for 14 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Felicidad works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Felicidad is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.fr: Agée de 60 ans, Marie Rose reste une commerçante débordante d’énergie. Elle a plus de vingt ans d’expérience dans la revente de produits alimentaires en détails. Mariée, elle est mère de neuf enfants dont cinq ont déjà quitté le domicile familial pour fonder leur propre foyer. Marie Rose veut continuer à faire marcher sa petite activité. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock de riz.
texts.en: Marie Rose is 60 and still bursting with energy.  She has more than 20 years of experience selling food products on a retail basis.  She is married and the mother of nine children, five of whom have already left home to start their own families.  Marie Rose wants to continue to run her small business.  She has requested a loan to boost her stock of rice.

loans.use: to boost her stock of rice.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 39 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She does tailoring. She has been in this business for the last five years, and it has been profitable.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase assorted sewing threads, buttons, and African print materials so that she can sew more clothes to sell and make more profit to support her family. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and expand her tailoring shop by buying more tailoring materials. In the future, she hopes to grow her business, open more tailoring shops, and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase assorted sewing threads, buttons, and African print materials so that she can sew more clothes.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rahila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Rahila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Rahila can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Rahila will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Rahila is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the lives of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rizalde

texts.en:
His name is Rizalde. He is 34 years old and from the province of Gen, Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Newly married to Jennifer, a factory worker, he has two elementary children. Being a tricycle driver is no easy task, but Rizalde does not mind the scorching sun nor the rains on the road during the rainy season as long as he can provide for his family. 

He has been a tricycle driver for four years already. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel. Proper and regular maintenance of his tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. In view of this, he is humbly seeking your help in the amount of 10,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle.

Rizalde's simple dream is to buy one more tricycle to improve his income and give his young family a better quality of life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for his tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 50-year-old married mother of four children. Seven years ago, she started knitting to cover the needs and expenses of her family for she is their only breadwinner. Her husband doesn't work due to health reasons. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to develop her business. She has creative skills in this domain as she participated in an exhibition.

Today, Ghada is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her husband's medical treatments. Ghada's family is her priority and she hopes to stay capable of satisfying their needs.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's medical treatments.

loans.name: Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Rose is 25 years old. She is a single mother and has one daughter, so she does all that is possible to provide for her and her siblings. She lives in the outskirts of Ishaka town where she does knitting and crafts. Rose started working at a young age as a domestic employee and gradually saved her money to be able to make the same traditional scarfs and bedspreads that are sold in the area. Her mother does this and she could stop being employed by other people. Currently she has a clientele in the area and thus has the means to be able to help her family.

She is asking for a loan through the group since, on her own, she is not able to buy beads, colored strings, embroidery, needles and other items since her customers are ordering a lot, especially this season.

loans.use: to buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa is a married woman with two children, both of whom are too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Manuel Albito

texts.es: Manuel es una más de las muchas personas que sus vidas sean visto beneficiados por los créditos, él cuenta que gracias a Dios y a su crédito su inversión pudo realizar en su cultivo de café pues sus insumos logro  comprar, afortunadamente obtuvo una buna cosecha de café. Manuel nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo porque en esta ocasión necesita cambiar la lámina del techo de su casa pues ya se encuentra en muy malas condiciones. Su gran sueño es cambiar el techo de su casa para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Manuel is another one of the many people fighting to improve their lives through the loans. HE reports that thanks to God and his loan he was able to make an investment in his coffee crop and buy materials. Fortunately, he had a good coffee harvest. Manuel needs a loan again because at this time he needs to change the sheeting on his roof of his house, because it is in very poor condition.  His big dream is to change the roof on his house to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy sheeting for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Lorivelle

texts.en:
Her name is Lorivelle, aged 49, resident of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Donald with whom she has three children; one is in college and the other two are high school students. Sending three children to school is a big responsibility, which led Lorivelle to go into meat retailing.

She has been in the meat business for twelve years already and has gained a considerable number of buyers from her community. To continue serving their orders, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for several kilograms of pork, chicken and beef. Your help will mean a lot to her as it will definitely sustain her business and thus continue to fund her children's schooling and daily needs.

Lorivelle dreams of expanding her business to completely pay their house amortization and be able to send her children to college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fresh meat (pork, chicken, beef) and processed meat to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia Juliana es una mujer trabajadora, ella se dedica a lo largo de la semana a dos actividades: a la venta de granos secos y a la venta de quesos.
La socia Juliana tiene tres hijos y es viuda, su deseo es ampliar su negocio de venta de granos secos  y así poder tener más ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida. ella solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y lentejas, 
La socia pertenece al banco “Virgen  Asunta” y a sus 55 años sigue adelante, y agradece  el préstamo que se le dio. Promete cumplir puntualmente los plazos acordados y pagar su deuda.
texts.en:
This borrower, named Juliana, is a hardworking woman. All week long, she works at two activities: selling basic, dried grains and selling cheese.

Juliana has three children and is a widow. She wants to expand her dried grain business and thus have more income that will allow her to have a better quality of life. She is asking for the loan to buy corn and lentils.

She belongs to the “Virgen Asunta” bank and at 55 years old, she keeps going forward, thanks to the loan she received. She promises to make her payments on time and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy corn and lentils.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha is 18 years old, a single freshman who resides in the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Law at a university in the province. His parents are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay his school fee.

Ratha has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him in earning a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary. He also wants to save money to build his own house and if he gets children he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees, if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay his university fees from the first to the fourth year, for a BA in Law. His parents are rice farmers.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a young man living in Khan Younis, Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to transport goods and inventory between traders with his rickshaw.

A few years ago Nidal Bought a new rickshaw and become well known and also has a loyal customer base. Nidal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Nidal can work more efficiently and increase his sales, also his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his rickshaw,.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan con 61 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Juan cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Juan se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 13 años.Solicita préstamo para realizar la compra de más caña y así poder incrementar la destilación de las botijas de aguardiente. De esta manera incrementar sus ganancias. Con la inversión contará con materia prima para la destilación de aguardiente.

Juan es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Juan is 61 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his spouse in the district of Callayuc, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. Juan has very good personal and work references from area residents. The residents of this locality mostly work in agriculture, trade and ranching.

Juan distills cane liquor. He has more than 13 years' experience in the field. He is asking for this loan to buy more sugar cane and thus increase the distillation of the jugs of cane liquor, thus increasing his profits. With his investment, he will have the raw materials to distill the cane liquor.

Juan is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has managed a loan before, which he paid off on time.

loans.use: para realizar la compra de más caña.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Mariée, Ablavi est une femme sans enfant. Ablavi est âgée de 44 ans et réside à Adidogomé où elle vend  des produits alimentaires et des chaussures tapettes. Ablavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Ablavi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des cartons de détergents et des douzaines de chaussures tapettes en vue de mieux revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ablavi is forty-four years old, married and has no children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells food products and flipflops. She buys new supplies twice a month from the market and resells them from a shack in front of her house.

Ablavi has requested this loan to buy boxes of detergent and dozens of pairs of flipflops to increase her sales and revenue. Her profits will provide for the needs of her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 4 boxes of detergent and 9 dozen pairs of flipflops.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widow, with seven children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eleven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is a married woman with three children. She lives in the town of Dumanjug, Cebu with her family. Her main livelihood is hog-raising, which helps support her family's living expenses. She requested this loan to purchase pig feeds, piglets and pay for the school fees of her children. Estrella hopes to generate more income and be able to sustain her family, especially her childrens' education.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima was born in 1969 year. She is married and has 2 children. Rahima is a higher educated person. She works in a local school. Rahima works more than 23 years. She has a great experience in this field. Rahima likes her job and she works with pleasure. She always wants to help her children for getting higher education. Rahima is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition of her son. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of her son.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. At 63, she continue to work hard. She cannot just stay in the corner and do nothing because for her farming is like an exercise too. She needs a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field. 
With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. Remedios has been in the farming business for more than 40 years now. It is her humble dream to experience a comfortable life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Eva Elizabeth

texts.es:
Eva vive con su esposo y dos hijas de 4 y 2 años, ella aporta gran parte de ingresos para costear los gastos de su hogar, su madre le enseño a elaborar tamales de elote y de gallina, hace dos años realiza dicha actividad como una fuente de ingresos, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
Considera necesario hacer la solicitud de un crédito para comprar elote, maíz, pollo, tomates, aceite, condimentos, etc., tendrá materia prima para preparar la venta de tamales, su objetivo es mantener a sus clientes satisfechos para incrementar las ventas e ingresos, ya que con dichos ingresos podrá continuar sosteniendo su hogar.
Sus aspiraciones son crecer con su negocio y darles a sus hijas la oportunidad de superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Eva lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 4 and 2. She contributes a large part of the income to pay for the household expenses. Her mother taught her to make corn and chicken tamales, for two years she has done this work as a source of income. She works from Monday to Sunday.

She believes it necessary to apply for a loan to purchase various types of corn, chicken, tomatoes, oil, seasonings, etc., so she will have the raw material to make and sell tamales. Her goal is to keep her customers satisfied to increase the sales and income, since with this income she will be able to continue supporting the household.

Her aspirations are to grow with her business and give her daughters the opportunity to improve themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase various types of corn, chicken, tomatoes, oil, seasonings, etc., she will have the raw material to make and sell tamales.

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johana es una socia responsable y emprendedora, que se dedica a vender productos arsenales especialmente chullos, un producto muy solicita por los visitantes. 
La socia tiene 27 años y su deseo es mejorara su calidad de vida mediante el crecimiento de su pequeño negocio, por eso solicito el préstamo para comprar chullos y guantes. 
La socia pertenece al banco “virgen Asunta”. Ella es muy responsable y trabajadora por eso se compromete a pagar puntualmente su cuotas establecidas, y agradece a los inversionista de KIVA  por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Johana is a responsible and enterprising borrower, who works selling artisan products, especially woolen caps, a very high-demand product for visitors.

The borrower is 27 years old and her wish is to improve her quality of life through growing her small business. For this, she asked for the loan to purchase woolen caps and gloves.

The borrower belongs to the Virgen Asunta bank. She is very responsible and hard-working, so she promises to make the established payments punctually, and is grateful to the Kiva investors for trusting in her.

loans.use: to purchase woolen caps and gloves.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en:
Ishaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ishaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ishaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ishaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Ishaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is maize farmer from Sabon garin Kuzuntu village. As a member of Babban Gona, Joshua is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Joshua would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Joshua can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Joshua is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Abdulrahman has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.
