Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulrahman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Abdulrahman can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Abdulrahman is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to  eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Bitrus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric tons of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Bitrus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Bitrus is thankful that he has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to  eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha tiene 42 años, vino desde Colombia en calidad de refugiada, enviudo hace 22 años a su esposo le atropello un vehículo desconociéndose el responsable, tiene cuatro hijos por los que desde ese entonces ha trabajado incansablemente todas las noches vendiendo papas fritas con pollo o salchicha  en la esquina de su casa en un lugar cubierto por plásticos, combatiendo  al frio y sueño con su sonrisa y la mejor atención hacia sus clientes. Martha  necesita el dinero para construir un pequeño local mejorando la presentación y sus ventas generando  ingresos para seguir aportando con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Martha is 42 years old, she came from Colombia as a refugee. She was widowed 22 years ago, her husband was hit by a vehicle and they don't know who is responsible. She has four children, for whom since then she has worked tirelessly every night selling French fries with chicken or sausage at the corner of her house in a place covered by plastic, fighting the cold and sleep with her smile and the best service for her customers. Martha needs the money to build a little establishment, improving the presentation and her sales, generating income to continue contributing to the household expenses.

loans.use: to build a small establishment.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Shehu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Shehu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

Shehu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to  eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kings School Seguku

texts.en:
Sophie is the Chaperone of Kings School Seguku, a school in the Urban area of Seguku in Kampala with 240 students.

Kings School Seguku has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kings School Seguku will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sophie ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve she student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-born diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for students.

loans.name: Fawziyeh

texts.en:
Fawziye is a 20 year old single woman from Lebanon, living with her parents. Her father represents the main income source in the family and works very hard to always being able to fulfill the family needs and to live a good lifestyle.

Fawziye in parallel with her study, works as a private teacher. Today, in order to pay her university fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that her target is to achieve a high position and being able to support her father financially.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a young man living in Rafah, Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to transport goods and inventory between traders by rickshaw.

A few years ago Hisham Bought a new rickshaw and become well known, also has a loyal customer base. Hisham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance for his rickshaw. By taking this loan, Hisham can working more efficiently and increase his sales and also his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to make some maintenance for his rickshaw

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is a hardworking woman with a huge heart. Despite her struggles, she is a determined woman who has managed to always maintain her positive attitude. Although Lily works long hours, she finds time to volunteer for various local organizations and she takes great pride in her community.

Lily has always been responsible with her finances; however, she experienced a bout of financial hardship when her brother passed away in 2008 at the age of 47. This left Lily as the sole caretaker of her elderly father, who was very ill at the time of her brother’s passing.

Lily managed to care for her elderly father on her own, but this responsibility caused her to miss a lot of work, which caused a significant drop in her monthly income. She ultimately fell behind on her basic living expenses and this caused significant damage to her credit as she did not have many open lines to begin with.

Her father unfortunately passed away, and after dealing with final arrangements for him, she has managed to catch herself up and is now on track.

Despite Lily’s obvious efforts to meet her obligations, her credit score is preventing her from financing a much needed roof for her home. Her roof is currently leaking and this is causing Lily distress as she does not want her home to sustain damage from the infiltrating rainwater. Lily’s home means a lot to her, and she hopes that it will remain there for the rest of her life.

Lily will use her Kiva loan to replace her old leaking roof, which will help improve the safety of her home and her quality of life.

loans.use: obtain a new roof to replace her old leaking roof, which will help improve the safety of her home and her quality of life.

loans.name: Green Circles School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Shifa. She is the Director of Green Circles School, a mixed school in the urban area of Fort Portal with 900 students. Green Circles School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Green Circles School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Shifa ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of competition in her business.In addition she also operates a food stall business that earns her another source of income.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a strong, hardworking woman and devoted wife to her husband, Willie. Despite Bertha’s hard work, she was left in quite a stressful situation not long ago. Bertha’s hardship resulted from her 20-year employment being drastically cut. The company downsized and left Bertha financially strapped. Her husband had just retired and this left the couple in quite a financial strain.

The couple fell behind on their expenses and this caused serious damage to their credit. On top of the financial burden, Bertha suffered some medical issues, which further damaged her credit. Despite these setbacks, Bertha remained positive, strong and determined.

Bertha has finally found her calling as a child care director, and she feels that this path she has taken in life is truly fulfilling. Bertha and her husband have recently recovered from their hard times; however, the credit history will take a bit more time.

The couple’s damaged credit has kept them from being able to finance their much needed roof project through a traditional bank, so they have come to SELF and Kiva for help.

Bertha and her husband are concerned about their roof, and replacing it would make them feel much more secure in their home.

Bertha will use her Kiva loan to purchase a new roof for her home, which will greatly improve the safety of their home while helping her rebuild her credit history.

loans.use: obtain a new roof for her home, which will greatly improve the safety of their home while helping her rebuild her credit history.

loans.name: Soeur

texts.en:
Soeur, a village chief and also a farmer, lives in Teab Thbeng Village with his wife (both in the picture, standing in-front of their house) and 2 children. Soeur needs to work on paper work from morning until evening and takes his free time doing farming. Soeur's wife is a vendor. She runs a grocery shop to earn extra money for the family. Soeur and his wife both need a lot of energy to do business; however, a car battery is not reliable. It has short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes the car battery runs out of power during night time.

After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor that uses solar home systems, Soeur decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy solar home systems. He believes this decision will improve his energy to run business and also save utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a home solar system.

location.town: Teab Thbeng Village, Banteay Preal Commune, Rolea

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Paulina has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Paulina would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Paulina can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Paulina will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Paulina is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Debra

texts.en:
Debra is a strong, hardworking United States military veteran who continually strives to meet her goals. She has been employed at the same job for 24 years, and she plans to continue her work in helping other veterans until she retires in approximately 10 more years.

She lives on one income and has managed her expenses well. She is very aware of her credit and is diligent in paying her bills on time.

Debra’s goal is to save enough money to live on after she retires so that she can remain fully independent through her retirement years. She lives in a modest home that she is very proud of and intends to remain there for life.

Debra has put a great deal of effort into maintaining her home, but she began noticing leaks in her ceiling recently. She does not have the funds to replace her roof out of pocket, and her home sustains damage with each passing storm. She is hoping that SELF and Kiva can help her preserve her home with a loan that will not only allow her to replace her leaking roof, but allow her to pay low monthly payments so that she can still meet her obligations and goals.

Debra will use her Kiva loan to purchase a new roof that will improve the safety of her home and prevent further water damage.

loans.use: obtain a new roof that will improve the safety of her home and prevent further water damage.

loans.name: Grupo Las Hermanas 2 Group

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 12 y 20 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Marta con el  afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la venta de granizadas, con este negocio tiene ella más de 6 años de realizarlo, gracias a Dios su negocio tiene mucha demanda pues la zona donde ella vive es de ambiente cálido.
Marta está solicitando un préstamo para la mejora del lugar donde tiene instalado su negocio, esto con el fin de llamar la atención de más clientes, ella comprara mesas, sombrillas grandes.
Su gran sueño es pagar los estudios de sus hijos, y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta is a 37-year-old woman. She is married with a beautiful family of three children between 12 and 20 years old. This humble family lives in a community of Nahualá.

In order to generate income and help her husband with the household expenses Marta sells slushies. She has had her business for more than six years; thanks to God her business is in high demand as the area where she lives has a hot climate.

Marta is requesting a loan to improve the space where she has her business so she can attract more customers. She will buy tables and big umbrellas.

Her greatest dream is to pay for her children's education and to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy tables and umbrellas for her slushy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make his home energy-efficient, which will save him money while building his credit history.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena con 54 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su esposo e hija, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.María Elena cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

María Elena se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 02 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería y hacer surtir su negocio.De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

María Elena no a tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa, es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
María Elena is 54 years old, in a relationship, and lives with her partner and daughter in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, in the country of Peru. María Elena has very good personal and professional references among the people who live in the area. The town's residents work mainly in farming, commerce, and livestock.

María Elena has a business selling groceries from her home. She has over two years of experience with this work. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and stock her business. This will allow her to grow her business and be able to improve her quality of life.

María Elena has no previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa; this is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock her business.

loans.name: City Junior School

texts.en:
Hasadu is the Director of City Junior School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kampala with 500 students. City Junior School has requested a loan, which it will use to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long,term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

City Junior School will repay its loan from school fees collected each term. Hasadu ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es: Susana de 53 años de edad,  de estado civil divorciada, tiene 2 hijas vive con ellas y con sus nietos Brighith de 16 años, Francisco de 5 años, Hanny de 4 años estudian en unidades educativas gratuitas, hace 18 años empezó a vender ropa en las calles hace dos años atrás alquila un pequeño local donde vende pantalones jeans. Susana con el dinero comprara mercadería  incrementando   sus ventas y ganancias cubriendo así  las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Susana is 53 years old, divorced, and has two daughters and grandchildren who live with her. Brighith is 16 years old, Francisco is 5, and Harry 4. They all participate in free education.

18 years ago Susana started selling clothing in the streets. Two years later she rented small premises where she sells jeans. With the loan money she will buy more stock so she can increase sales and income, enabling her to afford household necessities.

loans.use: buy more jeans

loans.name: Medalid

texts.es:
Medalid con 36 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus 03 hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Medalid cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Medalid se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería, con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio, en la fotografía se encuentra en un huerto donde esta realizando labores de corte y arreglos de plantas, asimismo se encuentra alimentando a los animales de corral, los cuales constituyen como sus labores diarias.Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio.De esta manera piensa mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Medalid es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido cinco créditos de S/.1000,00; S/.2500,00; S/.500,00; S/.2501,00 y S/.1000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Medalid is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their three children in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, in a rural area of the country of Peru. Medalid has very good personal and professional references among the people who live in the area. The residents of this town work mainly in farming, commerce, and livestock.

Medalid works as a farm laborer and she has over five years of experience in the business. In the photograph she is in an orchard where she is pruning and straightening out the plants and where she also feeds the livestock. These are her daily duties. She is requesting this loan to make repairs to her home and to perform maintenance on her equipment and tools. This investment will help her get her equipment and tools in better shape, which will have a big influence on her work. She is planning to improve work productivity and thereby be able to fulfill different needs for people in the area.

Medalid is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa. She has had five loans of 1,000 soles, 2,500 soles, 500 soles, 2,501 soles, and 1,000 soles, all of which she repaid on time.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home and to perform maintenance on her equipment and tools.

loans.name: Dayana Mishel

texts.es: Dayana tiene 20 años es madre soltera su hijo Rafael de 2 años de edad permanece junto a ella en su pequeña papelería la cual heredo de su madre vive con ella, su abuela, tía y prima. Dayana tranquila, amigable, trabajadora, necesita el dinero para comprar papel, fomix, marcadores, esferos, desea mantener en el tiempo su negocio ya que es  su única fuente de ingresos para alimentar a su hijo y salir adelante.
texts.en:
20-year old Dayana is the single mother of 2-year old Rafael who lives with her in the small stationery store she inherited from her mother. Her mother, grandmother, aunt, and cousin also live with her.

Dayana is calm, friendly, and hardworking. She needs money to buy paper, Fomi toys, markers, and pens for her store which is her sole source of income to feed her son and get ahead.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as paper, Fomi toys, markers, and pens.

loans.name: Otilia Isabel

texts.es: Otilia de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una venta de maletines, carteras y bolsones de diferentes estilos, los productos que comercializa son de muy buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; la clienta es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando para salir adelante, quiere acrecentar su negocio es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos en variedad y estilos. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: Otilia is 37 years old and she is a single mother living in her own home with her son.  She has a business selling briefcases, wallets, and purses in different styles.  The products she sells are of very good quality and she sells them at affordable prices, which is why she has attracted a lot of customers lately.  She is very active and she is always working to get ahead.  She wants to grow her business, which is why she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy a variety of styles of products.  This way she will be always able to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy briefcases, wallets, and purses in different styles.

loans.name: Santos Eleuteria

texts.es:
Santos comenta que el crédito anterior le ha permitido crecer en el negocio ya que tiene más animales y sus cultivos le dan mejores cosechas, a pesar de la falta de lluvia que hubo, gracias a ello ha podido dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Ahora ella solicita un nuevo crédito para poderlo invertir en insumos agrícolas, como fertilizantes, abono e insecticidas,también cubrirá el pago de mozos para poder realizar los trabajos de la segunda cosecha de granos básicos, pretende mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos says that her previous loan has allowed her to expand her business as she now has more animals and her fields have given a better harvest in spite of the lack of rain. She has been able to provide her family with a better standard of living.

Now Santos is seeking a new loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, compost, and insecticide. She also wishes to hire laborers to help with a second harvest of basic grains. Her plan is to continue with her business.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, compost, and insecticide, as well as hire laborers to help with a second harvest.

loans.name: Mwambisi Group

texts.en:
Habiba, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children, one of whom is in school while the others are grown up. She has been running two projects as a food vendor and clothes seller for six years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her clothes stock and has managed to repay all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees for her kid, to repay the loan, saved some in her account and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe (local cafe) stock with items such as kilos of rice, sugar, maize, and beans, as well as buying updated clothes to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of being an international businesswoman.

Habiba will share this loan with her loan group, Mwambusi, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe (local cafe) stock with items such as kilos of rice, sugar, maize, and beans, as well as buying updated clothes to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Karina Zelmira

texts.es:
Karina Zelmira con 45 años de edad,vive en casa de familiares,junto a su mamá y sus cuatro hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Karina Zelmira cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Karina Zelmira se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y de ropa al contado y al crédito.Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería específicamente productos de belleza para su negocio y gastos personales.De esta manera se ofrecerá una mejor variedad de productos al público y generar mayor ingresos para una mejora calidad de vida.

Karina Zelmira es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Karina Zelmira, age 45, lives in the family house with her mother and her four children. She lives in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru. Karina Zelmira has very good work and personal references from the people living in her area. The inhabitants of this place mostly work in agriculture and commerce and with livestock.

Karina Zelmira sells beauty products and clothes for cash and on credit. She is requesting the loan to buy beauty products merchandise for her business and for personal expenses. This way she will offer a greater variety of products to the public. She will generate greater earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

Karina Zelmira is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy beauty products merchandise for her business and to cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Garden View Group

texts.en:
Mahawa is a member of Garden View Group. She is married with two children, ages 7 and 2 years old. Both of them are school-going children. (see group picture; Mahawa is in the middle).

Five years ago, Mahawa established her used clothing business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material, and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells six days per week from 10:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Mahawa plans to use the loan to buy ten bales of used clothing for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account, which will be used in paying her children's school fees.

Mahawa and her group members need a loan totaling 7,500,000 SLL, of which Mahawa is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL.

Mahawa plans to give her children the best education, build a house, and live a happy life. Mahawa and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ten bales of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Zubairu

texts.en:
Zubairu is a Babban Gona farmer. Zubairu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Zubairu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Zubairu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Zubairu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Zubairu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about lacking the money to pay for his children's school fees and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy improved machinery and hire skilled labour.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early 30s, is single with no children. He has been running a general store for five years now. He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Joseph's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the general store inventory, and he repaid all of his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loans. He used the profits to repay his loans, take care of himself and his family, open another general shop in a different area and cover his household expenses.

Joseph will use this loan to buy the best-selling items in the general store. Joseph will be accountable for paying back the loan. He dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy the best-selling items for his general store.

loans.name: Gabisi United Group

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Fatmata, who is married with one child. Fatmata belongs to a solidarity group of five women, who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Gabisi United” is the name of Fatmata’s solidarity group.

“Gabisi United” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata will receive 1, 000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to purchase more clothing materials for her business. (See group picture, in which Fatmata is in the middle).

Fatmata established her clothing materials business 15 years ago; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. Fatmata uses her profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and support her child’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week. Fatmata is a hardworking women; she opens her business from 9 a.m to 6 p.m.

In the future, Fatmata plans to support her child to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Cotton Group

texts.en:
Abibatu is a member of the Cotton solidarity group (see group picture, in which Abibatu stands on the right). She sells used clothing materials. Abibatu has been selling clothing materials for the past 10 years. She uses the proceeds of her business to provide a livelihood for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business.

Abibatu and the other group members of Cotton solidarity group are requesting their first loan. Abibatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Abibatu will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to purchase more bales of cotton materials for her business.

Abibatu is 23 years old, married and has no children. Abibatu hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house.

Abibatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of cotton materials for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 32-year-old woman. She is married with four children. She lives in a rural community within Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She raises chicken and sells it in the community or at the market to earn a living, and has been doing this for two years.

Annie requested a loan to buy small chicks, a chicken feeder, and a drinking can to assist her in running her poultry business. She plans to use her profits to help cover her family's daily expenses and also provide better education for her children.

She recently joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy small chicks, a chicken feeder, and a drinking can for her poultry business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 40 years old and married with eight children. She lives near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She raises chicken and sells it in the community or at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Janet needs a loan to buy small, day-old chicks, a chicken feeder, and a drinking can to assist her in running the business. She hopes to meet her family's weekly expenses with the profit she makes and provide a better living for her family.

She recently joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy small, day-old chicks, a chicken feeder, and a drinking can for her poultry business.

loans.name: Bernarda De Jesus

texts.es: Bernarda de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia, gracias a sus ventas es como logra salir adelante con su familia, anterior mente solicito un credito para mejorar una parte de su vivienda, hoy vuelve a solicitar un credito para repellar las paredes y comprar los materiales de contruccion necesarios y asi teminar de mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Bernarda, 44, lives with her husband and daughter in a house that they own.  She operates a small store from a space in the house and her income from the business helps to cover the family's expenses.  She used a previous loan to make improvements to her house and is applying for a new loan that she will use to repair the walls of the house.  The investment will allow her to pay for the construction materials that she needs to carry out the project.

loans.use: to pay for the materials she needs to carry out a home improvement project

loans.name: Area Best Group

texts.en:
Isatu is a 31-year-old businesswoman. She is a woman from the “Area Best“ solidarity group. The group has three members who are all women. (See the group picture, in which Isatu is in the middle).

Isatu has been in the provisions business for the past 13 years. She opens her business six days a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Isatu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays for school, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Isatu and her group members need a total of 9,500,000 SLL of which Isatu is entitled to 3,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy an additional bag of rice, one carton of sardines, one bag of sugar, three cartons of corn, etc., for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Isatu is married and has two children, age 11 and 6; they are both school-going children.

In the future, Isatu plans to generate more money to provide for her children a university education. She believes educating her children to university will better the lives of her family.

Isatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy an additional bag of rice, one carton of sardines, one bag of sugar, and three cartons of corn.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 31 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

Analisa has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Analisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, soap, noodles, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Eliana

texts.es: Carmen tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera su hijo Gabriel tiene 3 meses, ella se dedica a confeccionar hace 8 años atrás uniformes deportivos, delantales para estudiantes, vendedores, cocineros, estilistas. Carmen necesita el dinero para comprar materia prima para confeccionar, surtir su  pequeño negocio para vender al instante no bajo pedido anhela mucho que su microempresa crezca obteniendo dinero para a ofrecerle calidad de vida a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: Carmen, 35, has a 3-month old son named Gabriel.  She started a clothing manufacturing business 8 years ago and makes school uniforms and smocks for cooks, hair stylists and others.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy materials for making the clothing she sells.  The investment will ensure that she has the supplies she needs to fill orders as they come in and, in turn, grow her business.  Carmen is a single mother and her income from the business will allow her to provide her little son with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials for her clothing manufacturing business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of jade and silver.

Gabriel has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"It's been more than 30 years since I got started in handcrafted jewelry. Now is when I most treasure what I do, because it has allowed me to bring food to the table and provide my children with an education.

"This microcredit will allow me to prepare for the holiday season and increase the number of items I have available for purchase. Many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Gabriel's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8680

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of jade and silver.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her mid-30s, is single with two children. One is still small and the other one is in school. She has been running a pharmacy business for ten years now. She works from 8 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the pharmacy stock and has managed to repay all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay loans, buy a plot of land, pay for her mother's treatment, buy a TV set and radio, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast-selling medicines for her pharmacy.

Fatuma will be accountable for paying back the loan. She dreams of building her own house.

loans.use: to buy the fast-selling medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Annie Medaly

texts.es:
Annie con 21 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Annie se dedica a la venta de ceviche en su domicilio, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 03 años,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de activo fijo, mantenimiento de su sala para la venta de su ceviche para su negocio.De esta manera le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Annie es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Annie, 21, lives in a rural part of Peru's "departamento" of Lambayeque with her partner and their two children.  Farming and small commercial businesses are common sources of income for people here.

Annie operates a small business making and selling ceviche.  She started the business 3 years ago and operates it from a space in her house.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to improve the space where she operates the business.  The investment will allow her to better serve her customers and, in turn, grow her business.  

Annie is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to improve her food sales business.

loans.name: Ernicita

texts.en:
Ernicita is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Ernicita has been in this business for six years now. Ernicita works hard to support her family.

Ernicita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, fish, etc.

In the future, Ernicita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 51 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Eufemia has been pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

Flordeliza dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Genevieve works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling beauty products. Genevieve is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net, a gallon of gasoline, bamboo, and other supplies for her fishing business.

Genevieve has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 40 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She works hard to provide for her family by selling rice in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Gina has taken out and repaid six loans from NWTF prior to this one and has been running her business for the last eight years. She supplements her income by running a general store. She will use this loan to build her business and save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Elsy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elsy, manifiesta estar muy agradecida con Padecomsm pues considera que ha sido un apoyo fundamental para ella cuando ha tenido necesidad de capital, por lo que decidió solicitar un nuevo crédito para poder abastecer su tienda, comprara gaseosas, golosinas y granos básicos en mayor cantidad para poder disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias. 
Hoy en día ella se encuentra muy satisfecha por los beneficios que ha tenido al utilizar créditos en su negocio, ya que pudo mejorar su inventario, tiene nuevos clientes e incremento sus ingresos, ella y su familia gozan de una buena salud.
texts.en:
Elsy is very grateful for Padecomsm for providing her with essential support when she has needed capital. So she decided to request a new loan to stock her store, buy soft drinks, sweets and staple grains in greater quantities to satisfy her customers' needs and increase her earnings.

Now she is very happy with the benefits that resulted from the loans for her business, since she could improve her inventory, attract new customers and increase her earnings. She and her family are in good health.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, candies and staple grains in larger quantities to satisfy her customers and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Grupo Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad, es casada con una hija de 7 años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Auxiliar.
Juana (la que se ubica en medio de las tres en la fotografía) con el afán de seguir prosperando en la vid, desde hace 8 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica, con los ingresos que obtiene de este negocio a su familia ha sacado adelante. Juana junto a un grupo de personas está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima tales como: hilos de diferentes colores y estilos, esto con el fin de elaborar trajes típicos más modernos y llamar la atención de los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida son  mejorar su calidad de vida, tener su propio local para tener un lugar mejor donde exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en: Juana, 25, is married and has a daughter, 7.  (She is pictured standing between the other two women in the photo.)  Juana and her lovely family live in the small rural town of Auxiliar.  She started her business in the hope that she would earn enough to help her family move ahead in the world.  She hit on making and selling traditional clothing and 8 years on, she's still going strong.  Juana and the others in her group are applying for a loan that she will use to buy different colors and styles of thread for making clothing.  The investment will allow her to attract more customers.  For the future, Juana's goals are a better quality of life and a shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy different color threads for her crafts business.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store.

Haide requested her seventh loan from NWTF for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell . She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 36 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilia has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en: Arlie is a hardworking entrepreneur and the mother of three children. She earns a living by selling soft drinks in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of soft drinks to sell. Arlie supplements her income by running other businesses, such as an Internet cafe and raising livestock. Her dream is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia Marilu

texts.es:
Yesenia, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa de su suegra junto a su compañero de vida, son padres de tres hijos, ya tienen 10 años de estar compartiendo sus vidas juntos; ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras y el compañero de vida se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, actualmente cuenta con 200 gallinas produciendo huevos y otras 200 que les faltan 8 semanas para que inicien su postura. Este negocio lo aprendió a desarrollar con la asistencia que le dio el programa de Ciudad Mujer, posteriormente se apoyó con créditos para iniciar a trabajar de manera independiente y hoy en día tiene un negocio bastante amplio y estable.
Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar obreros,  ya que surge la necesidad de ampliar la galera donde tiene las gallinas y así poder separar las que están produciendo huevos de las que no, permitiendo así que se desarrollen mejor, Yesenia considera que le será de gran ayuda porque tendrá en mejores condiciones a sus animales  y de esta manera obtendrá más ingresos que le permitirán educar a sus hijos de una manera más adecuada y darles una vida digna.
Sus sueños son tener una granja más grande que le permita recibir buenas ganancias para poder pagar sus créditos y ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 37, and her family live in a house owned by her mother-in-law.  She and her partner have been together for 10 years and have three children.  Yesenia operates a business raising and selling chickens and her partner makes a living buying and selling cattle.  

Yesenia has 200 egg-producing chickens and another 200 that she expects to begin producing eggs in the next 8 weeks or so.  She started the business with help from a Ciudad Mujer program that teaches women how to develop their own businesses.  She got a loan to set up her business soon after and says that it is a strong and stable source of income now.  Yesenia is applying for a loan that she will use to pay for the labor and construction materials she needs to expand the pen where she keeps her chickens.  The investment will allow her to separate the chickens that are laying eggs from those that aren't and provide better conditions for the birds.  

Yesenia hopes that her earnings from the business will allow her to send her children to school and have better lives.  She wants to expand her farm and make enough money to repay her loan and support her family.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and construction materials she needs to expand the pen where she keeps her chickens.

loans.name: Michel Romuald

texts.fr:
Michel  a 32 ans, il est marié. Sa femme l’appuie dans l’élevage. Le couple a deux enfants (8-4 ans), tous scolarisés. 
Il a créé une petite unité d’élevage porcin (engraissement porcin) depuis 1999.. La proximité de la porcherie à  son domicile permet de suivre l’élevage. Les porcelets sont vendus aux bouchers. Les sources de revenus sont diversifiées.  De 2000 à 2004, il exerce des petits métiers tels que mécanicien, charpentier. De 2004 à 2008, il travaillait dans une entreprise en tant que plombier. Ces petits métiers constituent encore  actuellement des sources de revenus, mais c’est l’élevage porcin  qui est la principale.
La famille vit dans une maison louée. L’objectif est de développer l’élevage (augmentation de l’effectif du cheptel)  car le marché est sûr et ce, dans le but de pouvoir construire leur propre maison.
texts.en:
Michel, age 32, is married with 2 children aged 4 and 8 who both go to school. His wife supports him in his breeding activity. He started a small pig farming facility (fattening) in 1999. The proximity of the pig sty to his house makes it easy to supervise. The piglets are sold to butchers.

His sources of income are diverse. From 2000 to 2004, he held jobs such as mechanic and carpenter. From 2004 to 2008, he worked as a plumber. These activities remain a source of income to this day, but Michel focuses mainly on pig farming.

The family lives in a rented house. The goal is to expand the activity by increasing the number of animals to raise as the market is fairly reliable. This will enable the family to build their own home.

loans.use: to buy a sow and some piglets.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 42 years old, married and the mother of six children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by selling charcoal in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 28,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for one year and would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling plastic wares.

Sarah requested her third loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional items such as shorts, shirts, pants, etc. for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as shorts, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Rany

texts.en: Rany is single and a 19-year-old freshman who lives in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city. Her father is a motor taxi driver and her mother is a homemaker. Rany is requesting a loan because she needs financial help to pay her university fees for years one to four. With this loan, she will be able to earn a Bachelor’s degree and have a chance to get a good job with a reasonable salary in a financial institution. This will allow her to one day live in a nice house and provide her future children with an education.

loans.use: to pay her university fees from her first to her fourth year.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a hard-working woman entrepreneur.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rhodora dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her stall, to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es: Ana tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, Anderson de 7 años estudia en una escuela gratuita del sector y Emily de 2 años de edad permanece con su madre mientras ella pinta cerámicas para luego salir a vender por las calles de la ciudad, esta actividad hace 7 años  se ha convertido en el pan del día de sus hijos. Ana necesita el dinero para comprar algunas docenas de figuras en blanco. pintura, pinceles así abarata el costo de su producto, obteniendo mayores ingresos para poder seguir alimentando y educando a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old, a single mother of two children:  Anderson, who is 7 years old and studies at a free school in the area and Emily, who is 2 years old  and stays with her mother while she paints ceramics and then goes out and sells them on the streets of the city.

She started this activity seven years ago and it has become the daily bread for her children. 

Ana needs the loan to to purchase a few dozens plaster figurines, paint, and brushes so as to be able to lower the cost of her product, thus earning higher income to continue nurturing and educating her young children.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of plaster figurines, paint, brushes.

loans.name: Eliana Junior School

texts.en:
Grace is directs the Eliana Junior School, which is located in Kampala and has 700 students. The school has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water to its students. The school does not currently have consistent access to clean water and therefore has to spend a considerable part of its budget on firewood to boil water for the children to drink. Installing a water-filtration system will save the school money and give it a tank big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

The school will repay the loan from fees, which it collects each term. Grace hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases. She also hopes this will also increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to buy a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water to its students.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, age 28, raises poultry to earn an income. He has been engaged in this business for over 10 years. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Hoang Hoa, a rural town in the province of Thanh Hoa. His family is a low-income household in their village; moreover, the market need is low in this region, and his income from his business is not high enough to adequately support his family.

Thanh joined the Thanh Hoa micro-finance institution not only to improve his business, but also to improve his family's standard of living. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is that his family does not have a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet for his family's use. Thanh is grateful for this loan's ability to make this little dream come true for his family.

In the future, Thanh hopes to buy land of his own, to make enough money to provide for his children, and eventually to experience international vacation travel.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a hygienic toilet for his family's use.

loans.name: Santos Magdalino

texts.es:
Santos Magdalino con 43 años de edad,de estado civil, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Santos Magdalino cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Santos Magdalino se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público y de carga, cuenta con un mototaxi y una motocarguera, con la cuál brinda dicho servicio, con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 05 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con terrenos de cultivos de maíz y pan llevar.Solicita préstamo para invertir en los gastos de mantenimiento de unidades móviles. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Santos Magdalino es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,este es su cuarto crédito.
texts.en:
Santos Magdalino  is 43 years of age, and lives with his spouse and children, in the district of Pucara province of Jaén, Cajamarca, Perú.

Santos Magdalino has very good references, both personal and professional, from the inhabitants of the area. The residents of this town are devoted mainly to agriculture and livestock trade.

Magdalino Santos is dedicated to providing public transport and freight.  He has a motorcycle taxi and a freight motorcycle, with which he provides that service, with an expertise in the field of more than 5 years.

Additionally, he works in agriculture, and he grows corn and basic needs crops.

He is requesting a loan to invest in maintenance costs of his mobile units. This way he can earn acceptable income to improve their quality of life.

Santos Magdalino is a recurring member with Edpyme Alternativa, this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance costs of mobile units.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en: Jenilyn is 43 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, five of whose children are still in school. She earns a living by selling vegetables in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan from NWTF to buy more produce to sell to her customers. Jenilyn has been in this business for ten years. Her goals for the future are to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Mr Thao is 32 years old and married. He has been operating a food stall, selling fish for more than ten years.

Thao lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. His family is a low-income household in the village. In addition, this region has often suffered from natural disasters, such as floods and drought.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Thao is the lack of a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

In 2015, Thao joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution Limited Liability to improve his business. He hopes that this loan could make his little dream come true.

In the future, Thao hopes for his business to do well, to travel internationally for vacation, and for his family to be happy and healthy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de gelatinas, chocobananos, paletas, etc. se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 5 años y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de productos para la elaboracion de los alimentos y para la reparacion de una refrigeradora y asi seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  

She sells Jello, choco-bananas, ice cream pops, etc.  She has been doing this type of work for 5 years and has many customers, especially her neighbors.  

From her sales she is able to cover home expenses that arise.

She she is requesting a loan for the purchase of products for food production, and for the repair of a refrigerator and so as to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase products for food production and for the repair of a refrigerator.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafoods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like tricycle passenger transport and a coconut wine businesses.

Emma dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafoods to sell, so as to expand her business for the future of her family

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a vegetable vendor, selling vegetables and spices from her food stall to earn her living. She earns an additional income from preparing and selling food items. This industrious entrepreneur works very hard to support her three children.

Janice requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

She dreams that she will one day be able to save enough money to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle, who is married, has been operating a general store in the Philippines for three years now. She works hard to support her family.

Annabelle has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as shorts, sandals, pants, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as shorts, sandals, pants, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Mary has been in this business for 15 years. Mary earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing supplies for her fishing boat

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio con 64 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia,junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Gregorio se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos y patos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos.De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Gregorio a tenido 02 préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa, el último préstamo fué de S/ 1,000.00 a 12 meses, el cuál lo canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 64 years old and lives in a common law union.  He lives in his own house, with his wife and children, in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque, Peru. The people of this town are involved mainly in agriculture and livestock trade.

Gregorio works in the business of raising and selling pigs and ducks, with experience in this business of over 10 years.

His business is located in his own place of living.

He is requesting a loan to purchase animals and feed for raising them.  Thus, he is able to grow his business, is able to obtain greater income and is able to improve his quality of life.

Gregorio has had 2 loans with Edpyme Alternativa.  The last loan was for S/1000.00 for 12 months, which he repaid in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase animals and feed for raising them.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, noodles, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like milk, noodles, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Huệ

texts.en: Huệ is 33 years old and is married. She has been operating a food stall selling snacks for more than 10 years. Huệ lives in Hoang Hoa District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province, Vietnam. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the family income is not enough to cover what they really need to improve their standard of living. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be happy and healthy.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as a poultry business. Marilou dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, who is married, has been operating a nipa roofing business in the Philippines for eight years now. She works hard to support her family.

Evelyn has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Veachet

texts.en: Veachet, 20, was an outstanding student when he was in high school. He is from Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Currently, he is studying to pursue a bachelor's degree in Khmer literature at a university in the city. His family are rice farmers, and they totally depend on farming as revenue. He would like to request a loan because he needs money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. With this loan, he will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. In the future, he wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary. He also wants to build a new house for his family, and if he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor's or master's degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết is 52 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture farming food for more than 10 years. Tuyết lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to have comfort in her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Tuyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

In the future, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be happy and healthy.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Tư

texts.en:
Mrs Tư is 36 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling vegetables for more than 10 years.

Tư lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to do for comfort in her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Tư's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Tư hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: Noel de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de maiz y maicillo e inicio con capital propio y gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, el comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, el clientes esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Noel is 33 years old and lives in his own house with his three children. For 10 years he has grown corn and sorghum. He started with his own capital and thanks to his work he has been able to get ahead with his family.. He sells his product in the neighboring communities. The client is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure and improve the land that is shown in the photograph. Doing this he can obtain better economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure and improve the land.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry.

Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Gina has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Gleny

texts.en:
Gleny is 29 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gleny has been selling cugon leaves (used for roofing) in the Philippines for four years now. She has requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cugon leaves to sell.

Gleny would like to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cugon leaves to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and married with eight children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 10 years, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, school supplies and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell.

Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es de la ciudad de Concepción, él es carpintero, trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Hace marcos de puertas y ventanas, y es por medio de su trabajo que tiene los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Desea adquirir un importante lote de madera para su taller, es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder adquirirlos.
texts.en:
Victor is from the city of Concepción. He is a carpenter. He works every day from the early hours to fulfill orders from his customers.

He makes door and window frames and through this work has the necessary means to be able to help his loved ones. He wants to acquire an important batch of wood for his shop so he is requesting this loan to be able to do this.

loans.use: to buy batches of wood for his workshop.

loans.name: Quyên

texts.en:
Mrs. Quyên, a 52-year-old married mother of three, lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. where she has been raising marine aquaculture for eight years. Her income is unstable, making it difficult to meet life's expenses and save money.

Quyên's household is recognized by local government as poor; moreover, this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. One of the most critical difficulties her family faces is the absence of a hygienic latrine. She is therefore requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet. This will be Quyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes it will make her little dream come true.

In the future, Quyên hopes for her family to be happy and healthy, for her business to do well and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Alpedita

texts.en:
Alpedita is 46 years old. She is married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living, she engaged in a sari sari store business so that she would be able to provide for her family's daily needs with the help of her husband as a carpenter. For 10 years , it has helped alot in providing for their needs.

Alpedita aims to increase her income to give a good living, so she decided to take a loan to purchase more food items to increase her store inventory to generate more income.

Alpedita's plan for the future is to expand her business to sustain the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for store to sell.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo
