texts.es: Jose de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra (carton, hierro, cobre, aluminio)desde hace 5 años el cual inicio con capital propio, con las ventas que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas chatarra por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose, 44 years old, lives in his own home with his wife. He has made a living buying and selling scrap metal (cardboard, iron, copper, aluminum) for the last 5 years. He began with his own capital, and with the sales he makes he is able to pay some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy more scrap metal in bulk so that he can continue his work and have better income.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal in bulk.

loans.name: Jumela

texts.en:
Jumela is 46 years old and married with ten children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like noodles, chips, bread, canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future Jumela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like noodles, chips, bread, canned goods, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Juneidys Patricia

texts.es: Juneidys de 30 años es una apasionada por el deporte y la buena salud, en compañía de su cónyuge quien comparte esta misma pasión emprendieron su proyecto de negocio un gimnasio en el que ofrecen a los residentes de un barrio del sur de Barranquilla la oportunidad de mejorar su estado físico y mental, a través de programas como el body combat, un ejercicio cardio energízante inspirado en las artes marciales y toma de muchas disciplinas como karate, boxeo, taekwondo, tai chi y muay thai, así como aeróbicos, rumba terapia, y yoga. En sus instalaciones sus clientes encuentran asesoría personalizada, para un entrenamiento que permita obtener los resultados esperados, ellos manejan máquinas en las que el cliente trabaja directamente la serie de músculos donde requiere especial atención.  Ellos manejan programas integrales de nutrición con la finalidad de ofrecer un servicio muy amplio, es por ello que comercializan proteínas, tés, energizantes, entre otros productos que pueden consumir sus clientes para mantener su figura de acuerdo a los resultados que esperan obtener, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, capital que invertirán en proteínas, creatinas, tés, malteadas, entre otros productos.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar su capital de trabajo y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juneidys, 30 years old,  is passionate about sports and good health. Along with her partner, who shares her passion, she started a gymnasium. It offers the residents of a neighborhood in southern Barranquilla the opportunity to improve their physical and mental state through programs like body combat, an energizing cardio exercise inspired by martial arts, and disciplines like karate, boxing, taekwondo, tai chi and muay thai, as well as aerobics, rumba therapy and yoga. 

In her facilities, her customers have access to personal training, for a work out that achieves its desired goals. They have machines where the customer can workout the set of muscles that require special attention. They have integrated nutrition programs with the goal of offering a complete service. This is why they sell protein, tea, energy drinks, as well as other products that their customers can consume to maintain their figure according to the results they want. 

This is why she is asking for a Kiva Loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in protein, creatine, teas, shakes and other products. Her goal for the future is to increase her working capital and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in protein, creatine, teas, shakes and other products.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a young man living in Dier Al-Balah Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of high cost of living, he decided to transport goods and inventory between traders in his rickshaw.

A few years ago Ramadan Bought a new rickshaw and become well known and has a loyal number of customer. Ramadan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make some maintenance for his rickshaw,. By taking this loan Ramadan can working more efficiently and increase his sales also his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to make some maintenance for his rickshaw,

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif is 25 years old. He is an IDP. He lives in Bilasuvar region which is a settlement for refugee people. Vasif is a newly married person and he is taking care of his spouse and also his elderly parents. Vasif is a well reputed man in the local market. He does local house repairs and knows the details of his job well. Usually people call him for repairing houses, such as flooring, renovating, painting and also restoration. People are in great need for such type of masters. Vasif's job is more depending on people giving him as reference to the other.

Due to his excellence and his clean job performance he gets order from many people in the town for repairing houses, shops. Vasif is a very hard-working and energetic man. He wants to become a successful person and to meet the family needs in a better way. For this he plans to improve his business. He is planning to buy new tools. He requires 1200 AZN loan.

loans.use: to improve his house repairs business.

loans.name: Nicolas Obispo

texts.es: Nicolas de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso, colocar techo y puertas, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de todos los materiales de contruccion necesarios y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en:
Nicolas, 46 years old, lives in his own home with his two children. He has had a store in his home for several years and with the money he makes he is able to pay some household expenses. 

He wants to improve his home by cementing the floor and adding a roof and doors, but because he doesn't have enough capital he is asking for a loan to buy necessary construction materials so that he can have a safer home.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Frida,who is in her mid 40's is married with four children who are still at school. She has been running two projects,a pharmacy shop and cosmetics selling for three years now. She works from 08am to 05pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Frida's Third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the medicine stock,  to start selling cosmetics and has managed to repay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciate Kiva lender's for the support of their group. She earn some extra income which used to pay school fees,to repay loan and to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in her pharmacy  and to increase on the cosmetics stock. Frida dream is to expand her business to meet her customer's requirements.

Frida will share this loan with her loan group "NZASA"which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in her pharmacy  and to increase on the cosmetics stock..

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 40 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, all of them are still attending school. Her husband is the main income sources in the family in order to enhance their way of living. He works as a taxi driver. And Sawsan is a housewife dedicated for her house and family.

Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to take a loan from Kiva partner vitas s.a.l to complete the school fees. She will be more than happy to see them graduating.

loans.use: to complete the school fees for her children .

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to offer for sale.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like charcoal retailing.

Josephine dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to offer for sale.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is a 24-year-old divorced mother of one child and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Almost two years ago, she opened her beauty salon to cover the needs and expenses of her child. She studied beauty care in an institute and has a good experience in this domain.

Kawthar is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open wedding dresses section which will help her satisfy her customers' needs and attract new ones.
Kawthar hopes to keep on expanding her business more in the future to increase her income and provide her child with better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to open wedding dresses section which will help her satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 32 years old with 2 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Marie requested for a loan to buy chemicals, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2011, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 38 years old; he lives in Gaza with his small family. Three year ago he started trading birds; it’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.
He applied for this USD loan to buy different kinds of birds per customer requests, and cages and food for them, which will increase his income, helping him to improve the financial condition of his family. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of birds per customer requests

loans.name: Sari

texts.en: Sari is a 29-year-old, single man from Bidea. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Sari has an internet cafe for internet, play station and computer maintenance in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the west bank is bad because of the latest conflict. Sari took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new computer for his internet cafe. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new computer for his internet cafe

loans.name: Dallal

texts.en:
Dallal is a Lebanese married woman. She’s 37 years old and mother for six school aged children. She is a housewife, focusing on her family and kids and her husband is a farmer. Dallal at this period is in a real need of a little help from Kiva.

For that reason, she is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees for the coming year. She said that she is happy that she will be able to ensure them a suitable education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees for the coming year

loans.name: Bara

texts.en:
Bara is a 20-year-old single man from Tubas city, located in the West Bank. He lives with his family in a small house. Because it’s difficult to find a job in the West Bank, he wants to open his own business, which is a mobile phone store. He has experience from his previous job with selling mobiles and providing maintenance, and he has an entrepreneurial spirit.
 
In order to get started, Bara took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell. This will make him independent. Bara appears in the photo in his new store.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for his new store to resell.

loans.name: Woud

texts.en:
Woud is a 19-years-old single young lady from Bethlehem city. Her mother, the only breadwinner for the family, gets a low and unstable income. Thus income barely covers all the family needs. 

Woud is a student in the university where she studies tourism. She wants to get a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.
Woud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Woud will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Woud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 54 years old and married.

Estrella is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Estrella has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Kelly Johanna

texts.es: Kelly de 21 años es madre de dos pequeños hijos y en compañía de su cónyuge les brindan bienestar y educación basada en valores y buenas costumbres.  Esta joven madre en compañía de su familia residen en un barrio ubicado en Barranquilla y en esta localidad se consolida su clientela, que está conformada principalmente por sus vecinos y amigos,  a quienes les comercializa una amplia gama de productos de uso personal a partir de la oferta de catálogos especializados que manejan productos y artículos de alta calidad y son muy conocidos en el medio gracias a sus campañas de promoción. Kelly inició esta actividad en el año 2013, incitada por una consultora amiga que le manifestó las oportunidades y beneficios a los que accedería si se vinculaba a esta masiva forma de comercio, tan pronto como pudo realizó su afiliación y en la actualidad los ingresos de su grupo familiar se incrementaron producto de este negocio.  Ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes; cremas corporales, shampoo, splash, cosméticos y demás.  Kelly está muy feliz con su negocio y a futuro se proyecta como propietaria de un almacén misceláneo.
texts.en:
Kelly is 21 years old and the mother of two children. Together with her spouse she provides them their well-being and education based on values and good habits. This young mother and her family live in a neighborhood of Barranquilla and in this area she has consolidated her clientele which is made up of mainly neighbors and friends. She sells them a wide range of personal use products from specialized catalogs that carry high quality items and products which are well known in the media thanks to publicity campaigns.

Kelly started this business in 2013, encouraged by a friend who is a consultant. She showed her the opportunities and benefits accessible to those who join this massive form of commerce, starting as soon as you join. In fact her family's income has increased as a result of this business. She is applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. To respond to the requests of her clients, she will acquire body cream, shampoo, perfume, cosmetics and others. Kelly is very happy with her business and in the future sees herself as the owner of a notions store.

loans.use: to respond to her clients requests : body cream, shampoo, perfume, cosmetics and others.

loans.name: Membwana

texts.en:
Membwana is a married mother of one child, who is young to  attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rahab is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Rahab would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahab will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when her can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Rahab now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all her children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mirasol works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mirasol is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat, like paint, wood, nails, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Mirasol has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat, like paint, wood, nails, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 53 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future Marlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and all five children are enrolled in school.

Janet has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

Janet has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 58 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Loreta requested her third loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Karina Del Rosario

texts.es: Karina tiene 24 años de edad vive sola, su madre falleció hace 20 años, y su padre tiene otro hogar, de estado civil soltera, responsable y trabajadora se dedica a confeccionar y  arreglar todo tipo de ropa. Karina requiere el dinero para comprarse una maquina troqueladora de botones mejoraría  la presentación de sus prendas, obtendría mayores ganancias, ella a futuro desea ampliar su negocio  y crear fuentes de trabajo para otras personas.
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old and lives alone. Her mother passed away 20 years ago and her father has another home. Karina is single and is responsible and hard-working. Her occupation is making and fixing all types of clothing.

Karina needs the money so she can buy a button die-cutting machine. This will improve the appearance of her garments and will lead to more income. In the future, Karina hopes to expand her business and to create employment for other people.

loans.use: to buy a button die cutting machine..

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 48 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Vivian is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Vivian has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Deloreve

texts.en:
After using Mary Kay products for more than 20 years, and many years of retail experience, Deloreve decided to begin selling Mary Kay herself. Deloreve’s focus is to enrich the lives of her customers, as well as empower women through the use of these beauty products. Deloreve was inspired to start her business to make an extra income for herself.

Deloreve will use her Kiva loan to purchase a reliable computer, printer, copier, and some office supplies. The remaining money will be used for the purchase of inventory through the Mary Kay website for sale.

Deloreve is excited to start her business and live her dream of being a small business owner through selling Mary Kay.

loans.use: to purchase office equipment and Mary Kay inventory.

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en:
Soklim is 31 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She is a fish seller, which she has been doing since 2014. Her husband is a fish seller as well. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Soklim and her husband earn approximately $20 per day.

Soklim requested a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business, renovate her house, and support her children to finish university.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is a farmer from Cartagena Proper, Plaridel. He is 43 years old, married and an active member of Paglaum MPC.

Recently, Rene availed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to acquire a coco farm for added income.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa con 21 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa de sus suegros, junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Luisa se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con una experiencia desde hace más de 08 meses en el rubro, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería y otros. De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y seguir obteniendo mejoras en sus ingresos.

Luisa es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, no cuenta con experiencia crediticia.
texts.en:
Luisa is 21 years old, she has a partner and lives with her in-laws with her husband and son in the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, Perú. The inhabitants of this location work for the most part in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Luisa sells groceries, she has more than 8 months of experience in her business, which is located at her home address.  She requests the loan to buy merchandise and other items. This way she will be able to continue working and obtaining more income.

Luisa is a member of Edpyme Alternative, she doesn't have a credit history.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and other items for grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old, married and has one child. Their income is derived from farming. Her husband personally manages their rice field. They started farming 12 years ago.

Due to her previous experience, which was not a good harvest, Rosalinda decided to borrow money to purchase fertilizers for their palay (unhusked rice) production and to have a good harvest.

Rosalinda wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her palay production.

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 50 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Jelita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Jelita has been pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed thirteen times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is 42 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Norie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 20 years old and single.

Genelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Genelyn has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Genelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marianne dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, noodles, sardines, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is 61 years old and widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nema runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Nema has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Nema would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 62 years old, widowed, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She sells dried fish in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Magdalena requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nieva

texts.en:
Maria Nieva is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Nieva is 45 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Maria Nieva has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria Nieva requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, vegetable, seasoning, fish, pork, spices, etc.

Maria Nieva has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, vegetable, seasoning, fish, pork, spices, etc.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is engaged in food vending and a variety store. She make home-made smoked fish such as round scad and milk fish. She has been doing this kind of business for three years.

Emelita is married and blessed with six children. Five of her children still attend school, while her youngest child is still an infant. Emelita offers her smoked fish to her local community and nearby villages.

Emelita would like to borrow a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy three boxes of round scad, one sack of salt, plastic wrapper and yellow ginger for her home-made smoked fish business. She believes that through this amount of loan, she could keep her food vending and variety store progressive.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of round scad, one sack of salt, plastic wrapper and yellow ginger for her food vending business.

location.town: Global Village Quezon, San Isidro, Isabela

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel is a 35 years old married woman and providing for the needs of her only child. She has been selling grocery goods just to earn more profit. Her husband is selling crabs also. Despite the small income, it brought daily income which is just what the family needed. She wants to increase and expand her business. Another opportunity presented to her is to borrow a loan for buying more goods to sell to have a greater income to pay for the educational plan of her child for college. 

Mitchel’s plan for her future is to save money and to improve their living condition and pay for educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Meloysa

texts.en:
Meloysa is a hardworking female entrepreneur with four children, operating a general store in the Philippines.  She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

Meloysa has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.  She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Meloysa dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 54 years old and married, with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lucena has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Lucena has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mitelen

texts.en:
Mitelen is 48 years old and married with two children.

She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mitelen is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mitelen has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene is a married woman, 51 years old, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, vegetables, seasoning, fish, pork, spices, etc.

Rosene has been in this business for four years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, vegetables, seasoning, fish, pork, spices, etc.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 68 years old and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, soap, etc.

Nonita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from food vending.

Wilma dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Meredith

texts.en:
Meredith is 56 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store, like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Meredith has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store, like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 66 years old and married with six children. Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Anita has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, and snack foods

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mercedes is 44 years old and has five children currently in school.

Mercedes has a dress-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials, like cloth, thread, and needles, and pay for maintenance of her sewing machine.

Mercedes has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, like cloth, thread, and needles, and pay for maintenence of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Queenie

texts.en:
Queenie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Queenie is 51 years old and has two children presently in school.

Queenie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Queenie has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from food vending.

Norma dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec un enfant à charge. Akossiwa est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akossiwa nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz en vue de bien vendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leur enfant.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a married mother to one dependent child, and she lives in Adidogomé. She is a reseller of grocery items that she gets twice a month at the market to sell in front of her home. She is seeking this loan to purchase sacks of rice to sell and increase her profits. This will help her to support her husband in providing for their family and ensuring that their child gets a good education.

loans.use: to buy 7 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 45 years old and has four children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roselyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalie is 45 years old and all of her children are in school.

Rosalie has a fishing net making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 62 years old and married, with two children.

Francisca is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Francisca has been in this business for ten years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 53 years old and single with one child.

Lucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Lucena has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Lucena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store such as milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 53 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are still in school.

Felisa is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Felisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felisa has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 35 years old. She is a housewife and her husband is a taxi driver. They have two kids. Mariam and her family live in a village near Nablus. She wants to maintain her bathroom, because it’s very old. She wants to renew and make it healthier.

Mariam is requesting a loan of $1500 to meet her demand and buy cement, nails, caulk and other materials that can help to build the bathroom.

Mariam is very thankful to the Kiva team and its partner Alibdaa.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails, caulk, etc. so she can improve her house and have a healthy bathroom.

loans.name: Farhan

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Farhan is 29 years old, single with no kids, and lives in the Doura neighborhood in Hebron city.

Farhan has a small land for scrap and damaged equipment that he collects and then takes apart the good pieces. After that he sells them to the local market. He started his business six years ago. His family also works in the same field, so he gets his experience from his family.

The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the high expense of the scraps which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the high competition in the local market.

Farhan says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his project. Farhan thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy scraps from houses and shops, take them apart and resell them to the local market.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a rice retailing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like her poultry business.

Erlinda dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 59 years old and widowed with four children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Florita has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 44 years old and married with six children, one of whom is still in school, Maricar works very hard to provide for them.

Maricar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Maricar has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Maricar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, and snack foods

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a widowed woman, 60 years old with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like bamboo, fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Nelia has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo, fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Devina

texts.en:
Devina is 30 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are still in school.

Devina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Devina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Devina has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Devina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Nelson Guerlyne

texts.fr: Guerlyne a 36 ans.  Mariée et mère d’un enfant qui commence à peine d’être scolarisé, elle est propriétaire d’une boutique de revente de boisson gazeuse. Elle compte diversifier l’activité en ajoutant des produits alimentaires dans sa boutique. Elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus pour avoir un grand changement dans sa situation économique.
texts.en: Guerlyne, age 36, is married with one child who just started attending school. She owns a shop where she sells soft drinks. She plans to diversify her commercial activity by adding grocery items to her inventory. She hopes to bolster her revenue and trigger significant changes to her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Mujeres Importantes Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Importantes acaba de pasar su segundo ciclo con mucha expectativas de crecimiento, en su mayoría son comerciantes. Una de ellas es la Sra. Luz, una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esfuerza por sus seres queridos.
Ella se dedica a lavar prendas de todo tipo, y que por medio de su humilde trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jabones, suavizantes de ropas, lavandinas y otros, de manera a seguir con su trabajo, y cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Importantes” (Important Women) is into its second loan cycle with great expectations for growth. Most of the women are merchants. One of them is Sra. Luz, a hardworking and enterprising woman who strives on behalf of her loved ones.

Luz earns her living by washing all types of clothes. Through this humble form of work, she has the means to provide her family with a decent quality of life. Luz is requesting a loan in order to buy soap, fabric softener, bleach, and other supplies so that she can continue her work and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy soap, fabric softener, bleach, and other supplies.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a widowed woman, 64 years old, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like bread, juice, sugar, flour and other materials for her business.

Felicitas has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bread, juice, sugar, flour and other materials for her business

loans.name: Carila

texts.en:
Carila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Carila has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and shrimp to sell in her local market.

Carila has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp to sell in her local market

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 44 years old and married with three children.

Judith works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, candies, shampoo, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

Judith has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Judith aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, candies, shampoo, cereals, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Geraldine works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from dried fish.

Geraldine is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, gasoline and bamboo for her fishing business.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, gasoline and bamboo

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Luisa has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marta Teresa

texts.es:
Marta, tiene 23 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 10 meses de nacido, su compañero de vida tiene 32 años de edad; ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, desde hace cinco años, trabaja junto a su esposo.
Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para incrementar su inventario y de igual manera alimentarlos mejor para que se engorden y sea más fácil venderlos.
Su visión es poder incrementar la producción de pollos y obtener más ingresos ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familar.
texts.en:
Marta is 23 years old. She has a life partner and a 10-month-old baby boy. Her partner is 32 years old. 

Her business is raising broiler chickens, a job she has been doing for the last 5 years, together with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to invest in buying more chickens, as well as feed and vitamins, to increase her stock and also feed them better, so they will get fat and be easier to sell.

Her vision is to increase her chicken production in order to increase her earnings and offer a better quality of life to her family group.

loans.use: to invest in buying more chickens, as well as feed and vitamins, to increase her stock and also feed them better

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi operates a retail shop and does crop farming as well. He is also a very responsible married man with children who is charged with the responsibility of providing for his family.

His desire is to own a bigger shop, and he is doing his best to achieve his dream. Hamisi wants to add foodstuffs that his customers are demanding in his shop so he can have added income.

Hamisi intends to use the requested money to buy foodstuffs like rice and maize flour, plus sugar and sodas, to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like rice and maize flour, plus sugar and sodas, to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz Mercedes

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 57 años de edad, de destado civil casada, su esposo es chofer, con lo que gana el no pueden cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de edredondes, ella ya lleva en esta actividad 5 años, sus ingresos los obtiene de la venta de este producto, Beatriz solicita de este credito  para incrementar su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias y asi poder ayudar con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Beatriz is 57 years old, married, and her husband is a driver. With what he earns, he can't cover the household expenses. She works buying and selling quilts, she has been doing this work for 5 years now, and she gets her income from the sale of this product. Beatriz asks for this loan to increase her business and get more earnings and, so, to be able to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to invest in selling quilts.

loans.name: Jean Pascal

texts.fr:
28 ans, Jean Pascal est marié. Sa femme vend des accessoires téléphoniques. Le couple est parent de deux petits enfants de un an et demi et trois ans et demi (pas encore scolarisés).
Il vend des lunettes de soleil depuis très jeune. Et puis en 2008 et 2009 il travaillait dans une entreprise franche. A cause de la crise 2009, l'entreprise est fermée et il retournait dans son commerce de lunettes de soleil. Son désir est de développer les activités du couple, il décide de ne plus travailler dans une entreprise mais diriger ses propres activités, les promouvoir et les améliorer.
Son objectif est d'acheter un terrain et construire sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
Jean Pascal is a 28-year-old, married man. His wife sells mobile phone accessories. The couple has two small children, one who is one and a half and one who is three and a half (neither yet in school).

He has been selling sunglasses since he was very young. And then in 2008 and 2009, he worked in a free export company. The company closed as a result of the 2009 crisis, and he returned to his sunglasses business. He hopes to expand the couple's businesses. He decided to no longer work in a company but to manage his own businesses to promote and improve them.

His goal is to one day buy a plot of land and to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy assorted sunglasses

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de plasticos para mesa desde hace 11 años, vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa con las ganancias que el logra obtener es como puede salir adelante con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas platicos por docenas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Manuel is forty-one years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. He has worked selling plastic tablecloths for the past eleven years. He works as a street vendor in the different markets that are near his house. With the extra earnings he will be able to get ahead with his family.

He’s asking for a loan to buy more plastics by the dozen, and that way he’ll be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more plastic tablecloths by the dozen.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is a retired government employee and also a member of Paglaum MPC. He actively participates the activities of the cooperative and nurtures its membership with the cooperative. Recently, he availed a loan to the cooperative to purchase maintenance medicine.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicine

loans.name: G.s Los Juveniles Group

texts.es:
El Joven Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, es padre de un hijo, vive con su esposa  vive en una comunidad de Honduras, su actividad principal es la agricultura, cultiva maíz y frijoles,  tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de esta actividad.

Carlos esta solicitando el prestamo para la compra de seillas para cultivar  frijoles  y esto le ayudara a  generen mayores ingresos en el hogar, para poder dales una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Esta muy contento de por el apoyo que Prisma le pude brindar, esta solicitando el préstamo  de forma grupal y sus integrantes son

don Edwin se dedica desde hace mucho a la agricultura.
don Orbin se dedica desde hace mucho a la agricultura.

 Trojes, Honduras - Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
The young man Carlos, is 22 years old, is the father of a child, and lives with his wife in a community in Honduras. His primary work is agriculture, growing corn and beans. He has a lot of experience managing this work 

Carlos is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds to be able to grow beans. This will help him to generate more income for his household and to be able to give his family a better quality of life. He is very happy with the support that Prisma was able to offer him. He is asking for a group loan and the members are:

Mr. Edwin Esmit, who has worked for a long time in agriculture. 

Mr. Orbin Antonio, who has also worked for a long time in agriculture.

Trojes, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: to grow beans which he has has his project.

loans.name: Alba Lely

texts.es:
Alba, es un cliente que nuevamente solicita un crédito para el fortalecimiento de su negocio, comprara güisquiles, tomates, cebollas, melones, fresas, uvas papayas, etc., asimismo adquirirá maíz para la venta de pupusas, de esta manera podrá continuar contribuyendo a tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio y pudo percibir buenos ingresos; los cuales le permiten mejorar el nivel de vida, siendo su familia la más beneficiada.
texts.en:
Alba is a patron that again requests a loan for the strengthening of her business. She will purchase chayote fruits, tomatoes, onions, melons, strawberries, grapes, papayas, etc. as well as corn to sell pupusas. In this manner she will be able to continue contributing to a better quality of life for her family.

She invested her previous loan in the purchase of fruits and vegetables for her business and she was able to receive a good income, which allowed her to improve her family's quality of life since they are who benefits the most.

loans.use: to buy chayote fruits, tomatoes, onions, melons, strawberries, grapes, papayas, etc. as well as corn to sell pupusas.

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en:
Tasiu is a Babban Gona farmer. Tasiu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Tasiu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona's support, Tasiu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Tasiu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. 

Tasiu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farm land and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Uwani

texts.en:
Uwani is a maize farmer from Gayya village. As a Babban Gona member, Uwani is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. n

Before joining Babban Gona, Uwani would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Uwani will use this loan to store the maize she harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Uwani no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Uwani hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 66 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque vivía muy alejada de la escuela; se caso cuando tenía 25 años de edad, pero su esposo la abandonó y la dejó sola con sus dos hijos quienes ahora ya son mayores de edad y le apoyan en los trabajos de los cultivos de maíz y frijoles.

Catalina, tiene treinta años de vender todos los días en la ciudad verduras como pepinos, tomates, ejotes, limones, entre frutas también, este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia para sacar adelante a la familia; ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. porque tiene que caminar por media hora, hasta donde toma el bus que la lleva hasta la ciudad, para ir a vender las verduras y frutas y por las tardes en la comunidad sale a vender ropa en ocasiones y otros productos.

Catalina, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para todas las edades, para salir a vender los fines de semana en la comunidad y para comprar verduras y frutas.

Catalina, sueña con tener un local en el mercado de la ciudad, donde pueda ofrecer los productos más visibles y apetecibles por los clientes.
texts.en:
Catalina, 66 years old, did not have the opportunity to study because she lived very far from school. She married when she was 25 years old, but her husband abandoned her, leaving her alone with her two children. Both are now of legal age, and they support her in farming corn and beans.

On a daily basis for thirty years, Catalina has been selling vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes, green beans, and lemons, as well as fruits, in the city. She started this business on her own initiative to get her family ahead. She gets up at 5AM, because she has to walk a half hour to where she gets the bus that takes her to the city, where she goes to sell fruits and vegetables. In the afternoon she sells clothes, on some occasions, and other products in her community.

Catalina needs a loan to buy clothes for every age, so she can sell during weekends in her community, and to buy fruits and vegetables.

Catalina hopes to have a store in the city, where she can offer products that are more visible and appealing to clients.

loans.use: to buy clothes for all ages, to sell on weekends in the community, and to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 48-year-old married mother of four children, who works hard to support her husband, who's a retired soldier, in covering their family's increasing living needs and her children's school tuition fees.

Sawsan is a hardworking woman, who opened her current business in June 2014 to make sure she can provide her family with a good monthly income. She started selling women's and men's European clothes and shoes. She is well known in her region with her good reputation and special communication skills.
Sawsan is working hard to develop her business, that's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special winter season collection and to pay her children's school tuition.
She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with special winter season collection and to pay her children's school tuition

loans.name: A'aed

texts.en:
A'ala is a young man living in Deir Al-Balah Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to transport goods and inventory between traders in his rickshaw.

A few years ago A'ala Bought a new rickshaw and become well known also has a loyal number of customers. A'ala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make some maintenance for his rickshaw. By taking this loan, A'ala can work more efficiently and increase his sales and also his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to make some maintenance for his rickshaw,

loans.name: Ma. Berly

texts.en:
Ma. Berly is 46 years old and married and has eight children, four of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ma. Berly has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF 19 times in the past to sustain it. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ma. Berly would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 51 years old and married and has one child, who is still in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lucila has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 30 years old. He is a farmer, is married and has two children. He attended school through the ninth grade.

Robert has been a cattle merchant for four years and he has fifteen years of experience working in agriculture. He learned both lines of work from his parents. Besides this, he also sells pigs.

Robert needs this loan to buy heifers and also to buy manure for the crop he has planted during the start of the rain season. Robert dreams of having a dairy herd such that he will increase his milk sales and income to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

He appreciates the support given to him.

loans.use: to buy heifers and organic manure.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura  is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 19-year-old single young man who left school at early age to help his father in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Almost two years ago, he started working as a product distributor in his father's electrical goods company. He is an ambitious man who proved his intelligence and hard working for his father and now he is helping his father in developing and managing the company. 
Today, Youssef is acquiring a YOUTH  loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to legally register his car which he uses in distributing goods. 
He hopes, when he starts managing his father's business on his own,  to expand the business successfully.

loans.use: to legally register his car which he uses in distributing goods

loans.name: Mwambisi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma,who is in her late 40's is married with one kid who is a grown up. She has been a food vendor for five years now.  Shew works from 11.30am to 12.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is doing great. She used the profit to repay loan, took care of her family, bought a TV set, a radio, to reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store.  She dreams of becoming an international business woman.  

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group Mwambisi which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina is a young and hardworking woman. She was born in 1995 year. Parvina is married and has a child. She has own business deal more than 1 year. Parvina buys women's clothes in bulk and retails them at a local market where she has point of sell. Her working day usually begins early morning every day. She works hard every day. Parvina also sells children clothes. She periodically renews the assortment of her goods and in this way she attracts more clients.

Parvina now needs to financial support because she is ill. Parvina is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a single woman with one child, who is still young to attend school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Rukia has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 26 years old and a single mom of two beautiful daughters. She sells spices and vegetables on a retail and wholesale basis.

She has been in the business for six years now. She decided to avail herself of a loan to purchase additional spices and vegetables to sell so that her income will increase.

Michelle plans to expand her business for her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Eli is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Eli would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Eli will store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Eli now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her maize yields.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Deborah has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Deborah would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Deborah can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Deborah will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Deborah is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Rhina Yamileth

texts.es: Rhina de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace varios años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra mas ropa de segunda mano por mayor, y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Rhina is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their home. She has sold secondhand clothing for several years and with what she earns from her sales she is able to fulfill some household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more wholesale secondhand clothing so she can continue with her job which generates a good income for her.

loans.use: purchase more wholesale secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Happy Group

texts.en:
Zainabu who is in her early 30's,is a single with one kid who is in school. She has been running a cereals shop for nine years now. She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

This will be Zainabu's Fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on her general store stock and has managed to repay all her loans successfully. She used the profit to repay loan, to pay school fees for her kid, to reinvest in her business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out stock items especially cereals such as rice, beans, peas, maize etc. She dreams of opening a hardware in order to raise her capital.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group HAPPY which has three members who will hold each other accountable for repay the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out stock items  especially cereals such as rice, beans, peas, maize etc.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: In some remote places in Bohol, people finds a business cutting down trees using their chainsaw. Celso is one of them. He extend a chainsaw business by cutting trees and even lumber to sell in his community. Celso is asking for a loan to pay for chainsaw maintenance and buy more lumber to sell. With this, he will be able to improve his business, thus augmenting his income. In the future, Celso hopes to make his business a success and save money for the schooling of his two children aged 16 and 18.

loans.use: to pay for chainsaw maintenance and buy more lumber

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a young man living in khan younis Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to transport goods and inventory between traders in the rickshaw.

A few years ago Mohammad Bought a new rickshaw and become well knownand he also has loyal customers. Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan Mohammad can working more efficiently and increase his sales and also his profit.


Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 43 years old and married, with two dependents aged seven and sixteen.

Corazon weaves nipa shingles, a roofing material usually used by people living in simple (not concrete) homes. She also raise hogs.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed, bamboo for nipa leaves and rice for family consumption. She wanted to increase her income for her family’s future. Any additional profit will go towards school expenses.
In the future, she hopes to see her children have a better chance in life through schooling.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nipa leaves, feed, piglets and rice.

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is a businesswoman from Trinidad, Bohol. Using her fridge, she has a thriving business of "ice-candy". Ice candy is a local term for popsicles in the Philippines. Living in a country like Philippines which is humid and most of the time hot, a popsicle is always welcome as a refreshment. Not only is she selling ice candy but the "salad" type.
