It is more expensive because of its ingredients of many types of fruit and milk. Aside from this business she also farm mangoes.
Ma. Christina is asking a loan to buy flower-inducer spray for mangoes, fruits like papaya, milk, mango, jackfruit and peanuts for her "ice candies". She hope to manage her business well so she can keep her two children ages seven and fourteen in school.

loans.use: to buy flower-inducer spray for mangoes and fruits like papaya, milk, mango, jackfruit and peanuts.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Anh  is 20 years old, married and has one child. She lives in rural area and raising poultry and cattle are her main job, which she has been doing for more than 2 years. The loan can help her to build a sanitatary latrine in order to improve her living standard, especially her children.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with three children. Vivian is 36 years old and two of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vivian has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Vivian requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase motor parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita con 43 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijas, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Felicita cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Felicita se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, con una experiencia de más de 15 años en el negocio, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio.Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, para la compra de más mercadería, ya que su negocio la beneficia económicamente.

Felicita es socia reactivada para Edpyme Alternativa, contando con historial crediticio en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
Felicita is 43 years old and lives with her life partner and their two daughters in their own house. They live in Lagunas in Chiclayo province, which is in the department of Lambayeque in Peru.

Felicita has very good work and personal references from the people who live in her area. Most of the people here work in farming, trade, and livestock.

Felicita sells groceries and has more than 15 years of experience. She runs her business out of her house. She is asking for a loan for working capital so she can buy more merchandise which will be financially helpful for her business.

Felicita is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa, and has a credit history with other financial institutions.

loans.use: to have working capital so she can buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old, married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nancy has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Nancy has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.en:
Nazgul is 19 years old freshman in the Journalism and Mass Communications Program at AUCA. She is a girl who grew up in a small village, but has big dreams. And she believes that not having money should be a barrier to develop future potentials of a country as Kyrgyzstan.

Nazgul is interested in the migration process of the world, especially of Kyrgyzstan as the last 5 years there have been too many citizens leaving Kyrgyzstan to find the better job and future in abroad, what disappoints her. The migrants children are left with their relatives and don’t receive enough attention from their parents. Nazgul wants each child to have a family and feel a love of his/her parents’.

She is confident that there can be created new policies and programs for our citizens to find a good job abroad and the government can arrange more conditions in favor of migrants.

Nazgul’s goal is to be a journalist for the BBC and forecast migrates’ issues and success on TV and in newspapers. She is from the south part of Kyrgyzstan. She has a family consisting of 6 members; one of them is also a migrant in Russia.

While studying at school Nazgul always used to hear her teachers saying that she was to work hard and she will gain a success in the future. She finished school with excellent marks and now is doing her best at AUCA. She believes that every person faces problems in his/her life, but all those issues have solution.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education costs for a BA in Journalism and Mass Communications.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a responsible mother of four children, aged 49 and a married lady living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband owns a electric shop and has a nearly a eight long years experience with this business. He is capable of convincing the customers with his calm and humble style and sell his customers the electronics they are in search of reliable and efficient.

But he is falling short of the resources to fill back his inventory stock, so he is not able to increase his profit amounts and for the betterment of the family and better sustain the business for his family's future. Therefore Shama applied for the loan so that her husband be successful in attaining what he is dreaming of and ace the target set for himself.

Shama thanks and pays regards to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husbands electronic shop.

loans.name: Roselia Yamilex

texts.es:
Roselia, es una madre soltera que únicamente vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, ella inicio esté negocio hace ya 4 años, su horario de trabajo es de  7:00 a.m. a hasta las 12:00 m.
Con este crédito podrá comprar fardos de ropa usada, en los cueles vienen  prendas de vestir como faldas, pantalones, camisas, chores, etc., abastecerá un poco más su inventario, ofrecerá precios justos a sus clientes y así tendrá oportunidad de poder continuar con este negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingresos.
Roselia tiene el sueño de poder crecer más económicamente, poder tener un negocio más garantizado  y con mejores condiciones para salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Roselia is a single mother who only lives with her two children who depend on her economically. Her business is selling used clothing and she started it 4 years ago. Her work schedule is from 7:00am until 12:00pm.

With this loan, she will be able to buy bundles of used clothing which include garments like skirts, pants, shirts, shorts, etc. and this will stock her inventory a little more. She will offer fair prices to her customers and like that, she will have the opportunity to be able to continue with this business since it is the source of her income.

Roselia dreams of being able to grow economically, being able to have a more guaranteed business and having better conditions to be able to move forward with her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing which include garments like skirts, pants, shirts, shorts, etc. and stock her inventory a little more.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una socia trabajadora y empeñosa, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a  dos negocios, ella vende artesanía y también se dedica al negocio de venta de harinas, estas actividades muy tradicional del Cusco. Con estas  actividades aporta gastos familiares y saca adelante a sus 3 hijos que estudian. 
La socia tiene 31 años y pertenece al Banco “virgen Asunta” en la provincia del Cusco. Gabriela necesita el préstamo para comprar  chalinas, gorros y guantes, y ampliar su negocio de artesanía, dado que es una actividad que requiere mucho movimiento económico. Su deseo de la socia es incrementar sus ganancias y tener un local donde expender sus productos, para trabajar tranquila y dignamente.
Gabriela está muy contenta por el préstamo, ya que le ayudara mucho para conseguir sus metas , y agradece a los inversionista de KIVA por confiar en ella. Por eso se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a hardworking and diligent member who dedicates a great amount of time to her two businesses. She sells handicrafts, but she also has a business of selling flour. These two businesses are very traditional in the city of Cusco. With these businesses, she is able to maintain the family expenses and help her three children get ahead in their studies.

Gabriela is 31 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Virgen Asunta” in Cusco Province. She needs a loan in order to buy scarves, caps, and gloves in order to expand her handicraft business. Her business requires a large amount of cash flow. Gabriela’s wish is to increase her earnings and have a shop where she can sell her products so that she can work in a peaceful and decent manner.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted scarves, caps, and gloves.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 54 years of age, married and has only one child. Her husband is a farmer. Gertrudes is a public teacher in an elementary school department. She decided to engage in agriculture for the purpose of planting coconut trees in their vacant lot. When the time comes for her retirement, this is a possible business she wants to pursue, - to become a copra (dried coconut) buyer in her barangay (village) . Gertrudes is preparing coconut seedlings for her farm because they want to plant a lot of coconut trees in her farm.

She hopes to earn enough income to help her child finish studying and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy coconut seedlings.

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.en:
Hidayat lives in the Northernmost point of Indonesia in Banda Aceh. Hidayat wants to become a reseller to earn some money for his young family.
Mr Hidayat who fulfills a leading function in his neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in his area. This is the second time Mr Hidayat applies for a loan. He  has an excellent record in repaying his loans.
This loan will allow Mr Hidayat to buy 20 filters and sell them on consignment to his community making safe drinking water available to 100  people.

loans.use: to obtain 20 water purifiers to sell to his community members providing them with safe drinking water in Banda Aceh, Indonesia.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 38 years old and married with three children. All of whom are enrolled in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Rosalyn has been raising pigs  for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.en:
Zhanyl is 19 years old and a freshman in the European Studies Program at the American University of Central Asia. She came to study at the university in Bishkek in the Issyk-Kul region of Kyrgyzstan. She is part of a family of eight: her parents, her elder sister, herself, two younger brothers and a younger sister. The last three siblings are in school. Despite the fact that her family usually faces financial problems, they are happy to have each other and appreciate their life.

Zhanyl made a name for herself in her high school. She was President of her school parliament. She won second place in the Kyrgyz Language Olympiad in her city and took part in the Kyrgyz language competition in the Issyk-Kul region where she also won second place. Zhanyl was not just a diligent student but also active in sports. She played football/soccer for Issyk-Kul’s regional team and participated in many other sports competitions.

In 2012 Zhanyl successfully finished the English Access Micro Scholarship Program, which enabled her to improve her English and heightened her desire to enter AUCA. In 2014 she was blessed to be one of seventy students who received full scholarships to the one-year preparatory program at AUCA. As a result, now Zhanyl has a mastery of English and earned high scores on her university entrance exams.

Zhanyl is ready to continue with her studies and social activities but needs help with her university tuition. She has applied for a 1,100 USD loan and hopes that Kiva lenders will assist her in paying for her fees.

loans.use: to pay her AUCA tuition and continue her education in the English Studies program there.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Clara  tiene 15 integrantes donde cada una pone el mayor de sus esfuerzos para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, todo esto a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia es una de las que integra este grupo, es una señora humilde, que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día en la venta de frutas que hace, y que tiene en su casa, ella es una persona que se sacrifica por sus seres queridos, pues quiere darles una vida digna.
La Sra. Sonia solicita de este préstamo para la compra de Manzanas, Pera, Piñas y otras frutas para poder venderlas y ayudar a su familia con sus ingresos y a la vez cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “Santa Clara” has 15 members. All of them are giving their best effort so that they can improve their living conditions and those of their families. They are all participating in the poverty elimination program.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Sonia. She is a humble woman who works every day by selling fruit that she produces, starting in the early morning hours. Sonia also keeps fruit at her house. She is a person who makes sacrifices on behalf of her loved ones because she wants to provide them a decent life.

Sonia is requesting a loan in order to buy apples, pears, pineapples, and other fruits to sell so that she can help her family with the income and at the same time satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy apples, pears, pineapples, and other fruits to sell.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.en:
Mehrangez is young and hardworking woman. She was born in 1994 year. Mehrangez is married and has a child. She studies at the 3rd course Pedagogical University of Penjikent. She learns Biology and Chemistry.

Mehrangez studies well and she dreams to be a good teacher in future. She is asking for a loan of 6600 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition in Chemistry and Biology, in order to become a teacher.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: Jose de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su nieto, el se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de los productos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: lámparas, rayadores, cuchillos, tostadores, etc. todo por mayor ya que la va muy bien en sus vents y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and grandson.

He sells household items door-to-door throughout the various neighborhoods and in the markets. He has many customers thanks to the quality of his merchandise and is able to cover some of the household expenses with his earnings.

Since he is doing so well with his sales, Jose is asking for another loan so he can buy more merchandise such as lamps, graters, knives, toasters, etc. at wholesale. This will allow him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more products such as lamps, graters, knives, toasters, etc. all at wholesale.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh is 50 years-old and she is married.
She has been working in agriculture, farming food, for more than 10 years. 
Vinh lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and other equipment to build a new toilet. 
This is Vinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Vinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, bricks and other equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Two years ago, Rosario successfully started her food selling business. She sells frozen goods to the community of Baybay, Leyte to earn a living. She and her husband work hard together to provide for the needs of their two children who are 21 and 9 years old.

Rosario wants to give a good life to her children. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy frozen goods such as hot dogs, ham, and sweetened meat.

In the future, Rosario wishes to have a stable business so as to have enough capital to operate her business continuously. Additionally, Rosario has successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, ham, and sweetened meat.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: The hog-raising business requires patience. This is something that Lorna possesses. Having raised hogs for three years has helped her in providing for her four children aged 2, 4, 6 and 14. Currently she has pigs in her barn and she is asking for a loan to help her meet the feed requirement that is necessary to fatten them. She is confident that her perseverance will pay off in four months when she can sell her hogs. Her income will be used for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Maivy

texts.en:
Maivy is 33 years old, married and has three children. The family lives in New Village, Tambulig in ZDS. She fattens and sells hogs to earn an income.

Maivy has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner GDMPC to buy feed and other supplies for her hogs. She wants to improve her business and save money to put toward insuring her children can finish their education.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her hogs.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a businesswoman from Pasay City, Philippines. She is 44 years old and the wife of Roberto. They’re blessed with 6 children, four in elementary school, one in high school and the eldest is now in college. They own an apartment rental business which helps them in meeting their needs.

Like other entrepreneurs, Ester wants to expand the business to earn more revenue. She aims to invest in properties like having their own house and lot someday and for the future of her children. She also wants to continually support their educational expenses. Aside from hard work and patience, capital is one of the bases for business’ success to take place. That’s why Ester decided to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan this year that will be used for the maintenance of her apartment.

Despite being busy managing the business, Ester spares time to attend her CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners. She is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of her apartment building.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with six children.  With one child in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 47 years old and married with six children, two of whom in school, Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

Lilia has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married 54-year-old mother of 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Susana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

Susana has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products..

Elvie has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Elvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Rakhta's Group

texts.en: Rakhta's husband runs a restaurant in a local market in Lahore. Rakhta is a housewife and stays home taking care of the household and their 2 sons and 2 daughters. All the kids go to school. Rakhta's husband is hardworking and honest. His specialty at his restaurant are his local dishes that include nihari, karahi and haleem. His tea is also very famous. He wants to improve his restaurant by working on the ambiance by adding better chairs and tables, crockery and utensils, and food ingredients. Due to insufficient funds, Rakhta has applied for a loan and hopes that this investment will pay off, helping them improve their living standards.

loans.use: to help her husband buy food ingredients, crockery, tables and benches for their restrauant.

loans.name: Namorkhoo Group

texts.en: Phomma’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Phomma and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Phomma and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sardar Begum

texts.en:
Sardar Begum is 61 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. Her son is a driver who provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which is always in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional.

Sardar Begum has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can repair his rickshaw. He wants to provide maintenance for the engine’s piston and one wheel and to pay the associated labor costs. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Sardar Begum is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her son and bring positive changes to his business. Sardar Begum thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for her son's rickshaw, including the engine's piston, one wheel and labor cost.

loans.name: Han Group

texts.en:
From Prey Veng Province in Cambodia, Han, 39, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. (She is pictured on the far left.) Han has cultivated rice since 2000. Her husband is 43 years old and farms rice as well. Han and her husband earn on average 3 USD a day.

Han is the leader of this group of five members. She has applied for a 1,850 USD loan through Kiva's field partner KREDIT to be apportioned among the group’s members. Han will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her rice fields. Better rice yields will help her increase her income as well as her family's standard of living.

Han’s plans for the future include buying more farmland, renovating her house and helping her children achieve a higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice fields.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie lives in a town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines, where most people in the community earn a living through fishing. She and her husband are in one of those communities that are engaged in this business to sustain their daily needs. They have been doing this for almost 11 years. Josie is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy gasoline and a new engine for their fishing boat. In the future, she wants to improve their livelihood and have a sustainable means of living for her children’s education. She has four children to raise; they are 19, 15, 14 and 10 years old.  Additionally, Josie has other business opportunities. Aside from fishing, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and is engaged in selling dried fish.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and a new engine for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 30-year-old woman from the province of Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has three children; they are nine, four and one years old. To earn a living, Mary Jane and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. They have been doing this for five years to sustain their every day needs. Mary Jane is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy fishing nets and pay for boat maintenance. They need these things to help them improve their catch. In the future, Mary Jane and her husband wish to improve their livelihood and have a sustainable means of living. Thus, they want their children to finish their studies and have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and pay for boat maintenance.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a 59-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 12 years old. Her husband is a fisherman, and she helps her husband with this business to earn a living. They have been doing this for 35 years and work together to provide for the needs of their children.

Thus, Cirila is requesting a loan for boat maintenance. Aside from this, she wants to borrow money for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. She is thinking perhaps of other business opportunities like running a store. In the future, Cirila wants to improve their livelihood to have better means of living.

loans.use: to pay for boat maintenance with additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 42 years old, married and has four children, three still in school.

Rosalina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosalina has been fattening pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
April Joy is a married mother of one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 29 years old, and her child is currently in school.

April Joy has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more inventory of rice to sell.

April Joy has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosean

texts.en:
Rosean, age 46, runs a general store business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. In her store, she sells grocery items such as canned goods, milk, coffee, beverages, snack foods, spices, and sugar. She also offers personal care products. Rosean and her husband have three children, one of whom still attends school. Rosean works very hard to provide for them.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy grocery items and personal care products to offer for sale in her store.

In the future Rosean would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and personal care products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Maribe

texts.en:
Maribe, age 30, is a fish vendor. She has been engaged in this business for two years. She and her husband have two children, one of whom attends school. Maribe is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fish to offer sale, as well as to obtain other essential materials needed in her business.

Maribe would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to offer sale, as well as to obtain other essential materials needed in her business

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional inventory to sell such as soft drinks, sugar, sardines, etc. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a vulcanizing shop.

Adelfa successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Adelfa dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell such as  soft drinks, sugar, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина в возрасте 48 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятеро детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Насиба живёт в сельской местности. Сама Насиба закончила педагогическое училище и сейчас работает учительницей в местной школе. Она очень любит детей, и старается обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что она желает видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую она получает в школе, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье. Поэтому вместе с мужем они имеют дополнительный бизнес. Насиба, начиная с 2011 года сотрудничает с Арванд. Она получала кредит на потребительские нужды, а также на развитие своего бизнеса. Насиба рассказывает, что после того, как она начала сотрудничать с Арванд, качество её жизни стало постепенно улучшаться. В данное время Насиба вместе со своим мужем хотят построить дом, где будут хорошие условия для проживания. Для этого Насиба обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a happy and responsible woman of the age of 48 years. She is married and has five children. Together with her family, Nasiba lives in a rural village. She has a teaching education and currently works as a teach at the local school. She loves children very much and puts her heart into educating them, because she wishes to see educated children. However, the pay she receives at the school is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Due to this she and her husband have an additional business.

Nasiba started working with "MDO Arvand" in 2011. She got a loan for personal purchases and also to develop her business. Nasiba tells that after starting to work with "MDO Arvand" her life quality has improved step by step.

Currently Nasiba and her husband would like to build a house with great living conditions. For this Nasiba turned to "MDO Arvand" and would like to get a loan to purchase building materials for building the house. She hopes for a positive result and thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build a house

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 57-year-old mother of three children living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Anwar has been living in the village most of her life and is an expert in managing livestock. Selling milk is her main source of income.

Anwar has to buy the required inventory for her business. Therefore, Anwar is seeking a loan to buy a reasonably priced bicycle made in Pakistan for rural markets in the country. This bicycle is affordable, cheap to maintain and can handle the rough terrain found in rural areas. With this bicycle, Anwar will be able to distribute her milk in new locations far from her home.

Your loan investment will enable Anwar to improve her business and get better prices for her products. Anwar would like to thank Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help and support

loans.use: to buy a bicycle for her milk business.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa lives a simple life with her family in Tubigon, Bohol. She is 40 years old and a mother of two teenage girls; they are 15 and 10 years old. Her husband is a company driver while Analisa is engaged in retailing purified water. She has been doing this for five years to earn a living.

She is in need of a loan to buy refilling water; a part of her requested loan amount is to buy materials for their house. She and her husband are renovating their house to have a comfortable living.

Analisa’s main goal in life is to improve their business and increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy refilling water and to buy materials for their house.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia lives a simple life in a small town of Gabunon, Tambulig, ZDS. She is 58 years old and a mother of six children. Her husband is a farmer also while Florencia is engaged in hog raising business. She has been doing this for 30 years to earn a living. Thus, she is asking a loan to purchase feeds and othe supplies. Aside from this, she will also buy vaccines for them and able to have a healthy growth. In the future, Florencia wishes to improve her business to have better means of living.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina con 22 años de edad,de estado civil soltera, vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Lagunas,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Diana Carolina cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Diana Carolina se dedica a prestar servicio como sastre realizando costuras,trajes,etc, con una experiencia desde hace más de 03 años en el negocio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de telas,hilos y otros. De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y seguir obteniendo sus propios ingresos.

Diana Carolina no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina is 22 years old, unmarried, and lives next to her parents in the district of Lagunas, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Peru. Diana Carolina has excellent references, as many personal as work-related, from the local inhabitants. In general, the people of this area make a living from agriculture and ranching.

Diana Carolina makes a living lending her services as a tailor, sewing, making alterations, etc. She has over three years of experience in the business. She is asking for a loan in order to buy fabric, thread, and other items. In this way she will be able to continue working and continue earning her own income.

Diana Carolina doesn’t have previous credit experience. She is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, and other items.

loans.name: Dionela

texts.en:
Dionela is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Dionela has successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Dionela dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 38 years old and is married with 3 children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional inventory to sell such as rice, soft drinks, milk, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Emily would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell such as rice, soft drinks, milk, etc.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia operates a small clothing boutique to earn an income. She is an energetic young lady, well-trained in the stitching of cloth. Asia belongs to a middle-class family, and she opened her boutique because she wanted to utilize her skills and abilities to help her husband support the family. Her husband supports and encourages her in pursuing her profession, and he brings her a variety of cloths and fabrics from a number of different markets. Asia stitches these into unique and attractive dresses, which she offers for sale.

Her customers, the ladies of the local community, appreciate her dress selections a great deal, and consequently her business is running very well. For this reason, Asia needs to purchase a new supply of clothing and stitching materials to adequately supply her boutique business. She has therefore requested a loan from Kiva through its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Asia offers her sincere thanks to her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in a supply of fabric for her clothing boutique business

loans.name: Phirun

texts.en:
Phirun is a 19-year-old single freshman, who is from Kandal Province of Cambodia. He is taking a bachelor’s degree majoring in International Relationship at a university in the city. Due to a lack of financial support, as his mother is poor, to pay his tuition fee from the first to the fourth year, he would like to apply for a loan.

With this loan, he will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he wants to work in a company with reasonable salary to improve his living, renovate his mother’s house and if he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee from the first to the fourth year, for a BA in International Relationships.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru: Зайнура молодая жена и мать годовалого малыша. Она добрая и милая девушка. Она отличается от других своей положительной энергетикой. С ней хочется долго общаться, настолько она приятная личность. У Зайнуры много забот, как полагается женщине с маленьким ребенком. К тому же она находит время для своего хобби. Зайнура любит шить - это ее страсть. Она шьет одежду для себя и своей маленькой дочки. Зайнура придумала несколько моделей и хочет скорее их реализовать. Для реализации ей нужны ткани и материалы. Своих средств ей мало и Зайнура полагается на заемные средства. Ей не терпится получить материи и сразу приступить к работе.
texts.en:
Zaynura is a young wife and mother of a one-year-old child. She is a kind and sweet young lady. She differs from others with her positive energy. Many want to converse with her for a long time, since she is so pleasant. 

Zaynura has a lot of responsibilities, as expected of a mother with a young child. Moreover, she finds time for her hobby. Zaynura loves to sew - this is her passion. She sews clothes for herself and her young daughter. 

Zaynura has come up with a few designs, and wants to create them as soon as possible. In order to create them, she needs fabrics and materials. She does not have much funds, and Zaynura is hoping for borrowed funds. She looks forward to getting her materials and immediately getting to work.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Hidoyatpocho

texts.ru: Это Хидоятпочо. Ей всего 33 лет. Она проживает в городе Душанбе. Хидоятпочо добрая и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и у нее четверо детей.  Хидоятпочо занимается шитьем женской одежды. Ей удобно, шить на дому, она параллельно вести домашнее хозяйство. Хидоятпочо от дохода своей деятельности копила денег, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Сейчас ей не хватает денежных средств, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить стройматериалы для ремонта. Это кредит поможет Хидоятпочо подготовить дом к холодному периоду года и сохранить в доме тепло. Она очень нуждается в ремонте. Хидоятпочо верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This is Hidoyatpocho. She is only 33 years old. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. Hidoyatpocho is a kind and responsible woman. She is married and has four children. Hidoyatpocho is involved in sewing women's clothing. It is convenient for her to sew at home, while she can also run the household. Hidoyatpocho has been saving money from her business in order to repair her house. She currently does not have enough money to repair the house and, due to this, requested a loan to buy construction materials. This loan would help Hidoyatpocho to prepare the house for the cold season and retain heat at home. Her house is really in need of the repair. Hidoyatpocho believes in You and Your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, repair her house and prepare for the winter period

loans.name: Oybiby

texts.en:
Oybiby is young and hardworking woman. She was born in 1996. Oybiby has learned sewing women's clothes from her mother. She has some experience in this field.

She sells variety of clothes for women as dresses, skirts, trousers, suit etc. She also sews national women dresses and sells them. Oybiby works hard. She needs to have a new sewing machine because her sewing machine has broken. Oybiby is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.en:
Shamsiya was born in 1966. She is divorced and has two children. Shamsiya is only provider for her children. She toils for the well-being of her children. So Shamsiya works hard.

Shamsiya is a sewer. She sews a variety of women's dresses. Shamsiya has worked in this field more than three years. She has regular clients. Shamsiya’s clients are the local women of her region.

She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment because she is ill.

Shamsiya awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her treatment

loans.name: Adarna

texts.en:
Adarna is 47 years old, married with seven children, four of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

Adarna has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buy and sell fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 65 years old and has two children.

Angelina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Angelina has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Jhona works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry.  Jhona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to resell for her rice retailing business.

Jhona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Edlyn requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Edlyn has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna works hard to support her family. Elna is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Elna has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Elna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Adjo  Holali

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Adjo est une femme âgée de 32 ans habitant à Adidogomè. Adjo est une revendeuse des pagnes qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois  au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour ce fait, Adjo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien revendre et de gagner une marge bénéficiaire qui servira à venir en aide à son mari pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a married mother of four, 32 years old, and living in Adidogomè She is retailer of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She gets her supplies four times a month at the market and resells her merchandise in nearby neighborhoods by circulating about. To do so, Adjo is requesting this loan to order lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth with the aim of doing well in her sales and earning a profit, which will be used to help out her husband in covering the family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 3 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Mubarik

texts.en:
Mubarik, age 41, is a mother of 3 children. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the local market, which is the sole source of income for their family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for his shop, including thread, needles, cloth, etc.

It is very important for Mubarik's husband to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult.

Therefore his wife Mubarik is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan amount.

Mubarik is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva's lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru:
Мархамат позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет четверо детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Мархамат мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Мархамат выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Мархамат никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Мархамат вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Мархамат выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Мархамат получает хороший доход. Муж Мархамат также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Мархамат с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Мархамат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Marhamat is a positive and hard-working woman. She is married and has four children. She lives in a small rural village. Marhamat dreamed of becoming a school teacher since her childhood, but circumstances meant that she was unable to get a higher education due to her family's financial shortfalls. Marhamat was married immediately on graduating from secondary school and became a homemaker. But, even while being constantly at home, Marhamat never sits idle. She and her husband strive to do everything possible in order to provide their children with all necessities.

Marhamat and her husband started their own business in order to have a regular income for food. They rear animals. Marhamat raises livestock, then she sells the milk and meat that she gets from them. Marhamat receives a good income from this business. Marhmamat's husband also works in a local workshop, and his work brings the family additional income. Their combined income is not sufficient to live at an average level, and they do not currently have enough funds to cover all the needs that they have. At the present time Marhamat and her husband want to buy a few more heads of livestock for fattening, and so she has applied to Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy some livestock. Marhamat thanks Arvand in advance for its support as a result of which her family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is 64 years old, married and has three children. The loan can help her to build a sanitarary latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from her chicken raising activity.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Eny

texts.en:
Mrs Eny lives in Bululawang, Malang Regency on Java Island in Indonesia one of the most populous places in the world.
In Indonesia, you cannot drink from the tap and most people don't even have a tap. For that reason, most inhabitants of Indonesians boil the water before they drink it. Or, if they have they money, they buy bottled water.

Mrs Eny attended a meeting by Nazava's sales team about alternative household water treatment options. There she learnt about Nazava Water Filters. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity
Mrs Eny who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area.

This is the first time Mrs Eny applies for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans. This loan will allow her to buy 20 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to obtain 20 water filters to sell to her neighbours providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is the age of 32 years, living in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a small shop where he sells beauty products; he has 12 years of experience. He contributes his full income for household expenses. He always tries to establish his business by offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are much in demand and expensive, as well.

Nazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair color, makeover kits, lipstick, nail polish, etc.

She hopes that through this amount will enhance the business.

Nazia is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to invest in her husband's cosmetics business.

loans.name: Thyda Group

texts.en:
Thyda, age 34 (pictured third from the right), is a rice farmer. She lives in the province of Prey Veng with her husband, who is also a rice farmer, and their three children. Thyda has cultivated rice since 1997. Between them, she and her husband can earn approximately USD 2.50 per day. Their children all attend school.

Thyda is the group leader of this group of four members. She would like to request a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. This investment will allow her to raise better rice crops to offer for sale, thereby improving the family’s financial status and standard of living.

In the future, Thyda intends to save sufficient money to buy more farmland on which to cultivate rice. Her goal is to build a proper house for her family, and to be able to support her children to earn their high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona is a young and clever single woman who lives with her parents in Tajikistan. She has been a sewer for three years, something she dreamed of becoming since childhood. Farzona sews a variety of women's dresses and always tries to improve her services.

Farzona now needs financial support because she is ill. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
Gorgonia, a hardworking woman with eight children, earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Gorgonia is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old and married with six children. Pacita works very hard to provide for them.

Pacita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Pacita has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, beers, cereals, toothpaste, bath soap, noodles, etc. 

Pacita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Mrs. Nam is 54 years old, she is a hardworking woman. There are two people in her family. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and small business are the main income sources of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly .

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 38 years old and single with two children, two children are presently in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Lorna has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell to her store like milk, coffee, sugar, bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, snack foods, etc

loans.name: Marie Benita

texts.fr:
Benita est mariée et son mari habite à l’étranger. Elle vit de l’aide financière de de celui-ci et de son commerce. 

Au départ, Bénita vendait des produits alimentaires. Elle allait acheter des produits alimentaires près de la frontière haitiano-dominicaine pour les revendre. C’était loin, fatigant et risqué. Après une intervention chirurgicale, son mari lui a conseillé de chercher une activité plus stable et moins fatigante. C’est ainsi qu’elle a transformé son local de 12 m2 en pharmacie, propsant des produits pharmaceutiques, cosmétiques, parfums, boissons, etc.
 
Elle possède des étagères en bois, plusieurs petites vitrines et une chaise. Bénita compte aussi acheter un bureau pour faciliter les contrôles de fin de journée. Elle cherche aussi à agrandir son local qui devient trop petit.

Elle ouvre sa pharmacie du lundi au samedi de 6h30 à 21h et le dimanche, de midi à 21h. Cela lui permet de commencer à vendre bien avant ses quatre concurrents qui ouvrent plus tard et ferment plus tôt. Pour fidéliser ses clients, Bénita veille aussi à être très accueillante et à vendre à des prix compétitifs.

Bénita a connu Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal en mai 2008. Depuis lors, elle a contracté plusieurs prêts dont les montants ont augmenté progressivement. Cet apport lui a permis d’augmenter son activité et son revenu net mensuel en conséquence. Elle a déjà pu finir sa maison et construire un local pour son commerce. Elle compte bien continuer d’augmenter ses ventes et agrandir son local.
texts.en:
Benita is married, and her husband lives abroad. She lives on his financial support and through her commerce. At first, she used to sell grocery items. She went to buy grocery items near the Haitian-Dominican border and then resold the merchandise. It’s distant, exhausting, and risky. After surgery, her husband advised her to find a more stable and less tiring business. So she converted her 12 squared meter space into a pharmacy, offering pharmaceutical products, cosmetics, perfumes, beverages, etc.

Benita has wooden shelving, several glass cases, and a chair. She plans on buying a desk to facilitate end-of-day inspections. She is also looking to expand her space, which is becoming too small.

She opens her pharmacy Monday to Saturday from 6:30 AM to 9:00 PM; and Sunday from noon to 9 PM. This enables her to begin sales well ahead of her four competitors, who open later and close earlier. To earn her customers’ loyalty, she is careful to be very accommodating and to sell at competitive prices.

Benita found out about Palmis Mikwofinans Sosyal in May 2008. Since then, she has taken out several loans that have progressively increased in amount, thus enabling her to increase her business and her net monthly income. She has already been able to finish her house and build a space for her business. She is counting on continuing to expand her sales and her space.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicines and cosmetic products

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Rafael tiene 16 integrantes, está en  el 1er. ciclo del programa de comités, donde todas trabajan y se fijaron como meta poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y esto a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Saturnina quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella misma se encarga de preparar todos los días sándwich de milanesa, chipas, sopa paraguaya, ensaladas de frutas entre otros, lo hace desde muy temprano en la mañana, y luego lo vende por su barrio. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su nivel de vida.
La Señora Saturnina solicita este préstamo para la compra de insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser: harina de maíz, almidón, huevo, frutas, etc. Entre otros, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio y a mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The San Rafael group has 16 members, and is in its 1st cycle of the committee program, where they all work and have set as a goal the ability to improve the conditions of their lives through the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Mrs. Saturnina, who works in food sales. She herself is responsible for the daily preparation of milanesa sandwiches, chipas (cheesy buns), Paraguayan soup, fruit salads, and other things. She does this starting very early in the morning; then, she goes and sells it all in her neighborhood.

Through effort and continuous work, as well as implementing the dynamic behaviors of a successful woman, she finds herself improving her status in life.

Mrs. Saturnina is requesting this loan for the purchase of ingredients to make her food, such as corn meal, starch, eggs, fruit, etc. which will help her to make her business plan a reality, and improve her sales.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food, such as corn flour, starch, eggs, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada lives in Matag-ob, Leyte, where many people rely on hog raising for a living. Because of the area's demand for feed, Diosdada established a business as a feed retailer. She has been selling feed to the hog raisers in her area for three years now, earning PHP4000 per month.

Diosdada plans to expand her business and increase her stocks of hog feed and so has requested this loan. She is excited for the positive impact that the loan can have on her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a woman who has been engaged in selling frozen foods for six years to earn a living. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children, ages 19, 15, and 14 years old. Her husband works hard as a company driver to raise their family.

Aside from selling frozen goods, Mirasol also sells vegetables. With this, she is in need of an amount to help her run her business continuously. She will buy frozen goods such as ham, sweetened meat and hot dogs. In addition to this, she will also buy vegetables to sell.

In the future, Mirasol is aiming for business improvement to uplift their livelihood and to be able to give good education to their children.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods such as ham, sweetened meat, and hot dogs; also vegetables.

loans.name: Rutha

texts.fr: Rutha, âgée de 28 ans, est divorcée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait le commerce de vivres alimentaires au marché de Croix-des-Bouquets depuis environ 3 ans. Avec cette activité qu’elle exerce, elle arrive à élever seule son enfant. Jeune et dévouée commerçante, elle est motivée à faire avancer son commerce. Malgré le soleil épais, elle s’y installe pour desservir à ses clients les vivres les plus frais du pays. Il s'agit du 2ème microcrédit que Rutha sollicite. Elle veut agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Tenant compte des avantages qu’elle a au marché, elle a fait une demande de microcrédit pour augmenter ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Rutha, aged 28, is a divorced mother of one child. She has been doing commerce in staple foods at the Croix-des-Bouquets market for about three years. Through this business that she runs, she manages to raise a child by herself. A young and devoted merchant, Rutha is motived to advance her commerce. Despite the strong sun, she sets up her merchandise to supply her customers with the country’s freshest foodstuff.

Rutha is on her 2nd micro-loan. She wants to expand her commerce further and provide herself with better living conditions. Given the advantages she has at the market, she has applied for a micro-loan to augment her merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of staple foods

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.es: Patrocinia de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo un cuarto para la cocina y baño pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de contruccion para poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patrocinia, 68 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner. She makes a living selling pupusas and with her earnings she is able to cover some of her home expenses. 

She wants to improve her home by building a room for the kitchen and bathroom but, because she doesn't have enough capital, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to be able to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mamura

texts.en:
Mamura was born in 1958. She is widowed and has an adult child. Mamura lives with her son and his family in the North part of Tajikistan.

Mamura is a very hardworking woman. She has been busy with sewing Kurpacha, traditional national mattressws. She has been sewing Kurpacha for more than 10 years. Mamura has a great deal of experience in this field and she has repeated clients. Her clients are glad with her work because she provides high quality services.

Mamura is asking for a loan because her son wants to be married but she does not have enough money to hold the wedding party. Mamura and her son need the financial support of Kiva lenders which they hope for.

loans.use: to make a wedding party of for her son.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a billiards game (entertainment) business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her billiards game.

Johna has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Johna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her billiards game.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, noodles, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Josie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. Paulina has been in this business for 22 years, and she earns more income from a general store.

Paulina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Welita

texts.en:
Welita is a 49 year old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Welita has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. Welita requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a hair blower, hair iron, make up, hair color, hair cream, shampoo, conditioner and maintenance for her business.

Welita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair blower, hair iron, make up, hair color, hair cream, shampoo, conditioner and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Sokhum's Group

texts.en: Sokhum’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokhum makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Lili

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans et mère de trois enfants, Lili est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Lili est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Lili demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien vendre puis d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et aider son mari à prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Lili, aged 32, is the mother of three. She is married and living in Adidogomé. A retailer of charcoal, she gets her supplies at the market twice a month and resells in front of her home. To stock up, Lili  is asking for this loan to order sacks of charcoal with the aim of doing well in her sales and then saving money for the sake of her children’s education, as well as helping out her husband to cover certain family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 11 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Betty

texts.fr: Betty, âgée de 24 ans, est divorcée de son mari et mère d’un enfant. Elle vend des produits alimentaires depuis environ 3 ans. Le microcrédit lui a déjà servi pour mettre en place et développer son commerce. Betty demande un nouveau prêt afin d'acheter de plus grandes quantités de produits alimentaires à vendre à ses clients. Elle veut augmenter son revenu et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie.
texts.en: Betty, aged 24, is divorced and the mother of one child. She has been selling grocery items for about three years. She has already used micro-loans for getting set up and developing her business. Betty is asking for a new loan in order to purchase large amounts of grocery items to sell to her customers. She wants to increase her income and provide herself with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cases of eggs and gallons of oil

loans.name: Romilyn

texts.en:
Romilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Romilyn requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Romilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is single with three children and has a loading station business (a store that sells pre-paid credits for cellphones) in the Philippines.

Arlene requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more load cards and for maintenance for her business. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling Personal Collection products.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more load cards and for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosalinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like bread, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 3 years. Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bread, vegetables, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
Mak’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Mak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Widyawati

texts.en:
Mrs Widyawati is the mother of 1 children and lives in Buduran, Sidoarjo Regency on Java, Indonesia's largest Island in terms of population.
In Indonesia, you cannot drink from the tap and most people don't even have a tap. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. At a community gathering, where the outreach team from Nazava was invited, Mrs Widyawati learnt about an easier and better way of getting safe drinking water. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Widyawati who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.
This loan will allow Mrs Widyawati to buy 10 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 50 people.

loans.use: to obtain 10 water purifiers to sell to her community members providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old and married with eight children. With seven of her children currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, dried fish, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen May

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helen May works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Helen May is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Helen May has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 48 years old and married with four children.

Nieves works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, drinks etc.

Nieves has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nieves aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, and drinks

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 30 years old and is living with her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Her husband has been doing his business of clothes selling for the past seven years and contributes his income to manage the household expenses.

Sonia's husband needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is not in the position to buy these clothes for his business purposes. Therefore, Sonia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn a more profitable income to support his family and business.

For this financial assistance, Sonia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in his clothing business

loans.name: Charya's Group

texts.en:
Charya’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Charya makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and a tailor to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phearun's Group

texts.en:
Phearun’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phearun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and an officer to support his family.
