loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, Maseca brand flour, butter, soap, soft drinks, snacks, bread, coffee, dairy products, sausages, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en: Dara’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Dara does work as a construction worker and seller to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Dailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Dailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Dailyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Dailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: Ry’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ry makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these people to safeguard the health of their family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis con 39 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y su dos hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona urbana.Luis cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Luis se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas, de variedad Catimor, la mayor parte de plantación de las 2 hectáreas que tiene es de tres años de edad (1.5 años) y el resto es de cuatro años de edad, actividad lo realiza en terreno propio a 30 metros lomas abajo de casa comunal del caserio Andamarca.Su producto de café lo comercializa en distrito santo tomas a compradores mayorista de la zona.Así mismo cultiva productos de pan llevar (yuca, vituca, maíz y menestras). Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría-venta de animales menores (gallinas, chanchos y cuyes), cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro; contando con más de 15 años de experiencia en este rubro.El destino del crédito será para asumir gastos de mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello asegurara obtener una buena producción campaña 2016 y por ende mejores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Luis es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Luis is 39 years old, and he is common-law-married. He lives with his spouse and his two children in his own house made of rustic materials. It is located in an urban zone of the Santo Tomás District, within the province of Cutervo in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. Luis has very good references, personal as well as professional, from the people who live in the zone. The residents of this locality mostly work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising.

Luis works in agriculture, specifically, coffee growing. To date, he has two hectares of the Catimor variety. The greater part of the two hectares that he has under cultivation (1.5), is three years old, and the rest is four years old. He carries out his work on his own field, about 30 meters downhill from the Andamarca Village communal house. He sells his coffee in the Santo Tomás District, to wholesale buyers in the zone. He also grows staple foods (Yucca, taro, corn, and legumes). Additionally, he raises and sells small animals (chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs). He has a lot of experience, more than fifteen years, in this occupation.

The loan will be used to cover the costs of maintenance for the above-mentioned crops, thus assuring a good production for the 2016 season, and therefore, better earnings. In this way, he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Luis is a regular member of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign with his spouse.

loans.use: to cover the costs of crop maintenance, and thus be assured of achieving a good production for the 2016 season.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of his or her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

texts.en:
Sarin’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Sarin makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a farmer and tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time needed to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Excelencia Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Mujeres de Excelencia es un grupo que se formó en el año 2007, en el Asentamiento de Aguas Frias, con el objetivo de tener facilidad de accesar a los financiamientos otorgados por Fundación Mujer, bajo el programa de crédito grupal. Tienen trayectoria y una excelente moral de pagos en sus créditos anteriores. Cumplen con los requisitos para permanecer dentro del programa. Es una comunidad en donde son escasas las fuentes de empleo, y los trabajadores son contratados por temporadas. Isabel es una joven con 33 años de edad, madre de dos niñas menores y vive en unión de hecho con el padre de  sus hijas. Ella fue beneficiada con una parcela que le otorgó el INDER hace varios años. Ahí es donde ella tiene su actividad productiva, la cual es la agricultura. Trabaja la tierra junto con su compañero, debido a que es la única fuente de ingreso al hogar. Ella siembra yuca, plátano, chamol y otros. Vende sus verduras a un intermediario que pasa en su comunidad. Necesita financiamiento para reforzar su agricultura con insumos y mano de obra para arreglar la tierra, debido que quiere sembrar más variedad. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia, por eso trabaja mucho, para obtener ingresos y salir adelante. Tiene toda la entrega de ayudar a sus hijas en los estudios para que éstas sean profesionales y personas de bien en el futuro. Cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para el manejo de números, y es por ésto que es nombrada como tesorera del Banco Mujer. Junto con ella hay dos socias más que van a invertir sus créditos en agricultura y porcicultura. Todas las socias buscan objetivos en común para bien de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres de Excelencia is a group that was formed in 2007, in the township of Aguas Frias. It had the objective of having easy access to financing awarded by Fundación Mujer, under the group loan program. They have a history and an excellent record of payments with their previous loans. They have fulfilled all the requisites to remain in the program. They live in a community with few employment opportunities and the workers are contracted by the season.

Isabel is a young 33 year old woman. She is the mother of two young girls and lives in a common-law relationship with the father of her children. She was the beneficiary of a parcel of land that INDER granted her a number of years ago. This is where she has her productive activity, which is agriculture. She works the land along with her companion as this is the only source of income for the household. She grows yucca, plantain, taro and others. She sells her vegetables to a middleman who passes through her community.

She needs financing to strengthen her agriculture with inputs and labor to get the land ready as she wants to plant more variety. Her goal is to improve her living conditions and those of her family.So she is working hard to make income and get ahead. She is totally devoted to helping her daughters with their studies so they become professionals and good people in the future.

She has the experience needed to manage numbers so she was named Treasurer of the communal bank. Besides her are two other members who are going to invest in agriculture and pork raising. All the members are looking for common objectives for the good of their families.

loans.use: to buy calves, feed, and other materials necessary for the development of the animals.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Excelencia Group

texts.es: Doña María es una señora con 41 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, uno mayor y dos menores de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace varios años el IDA actualmente INDER, le otorgó una parcela en la comunidad de Aguas Frias. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y con grandes deseos de superación, por eso busca financiamiento para crecer en sus actividades agropecuarias. Se dedica a la cria de animales y la agricultura. Tiene ganado de engorde y lo vende en la subasta. También vende leche en la comunidad, compra pipas y las revende frias. Siembra plátano y yuca.  Todo lo hace con ayuda de su compañero, debido a que es ésta la principal entrada de dinero al hogar, porque las fuentes de empleo son mínimas. Cuenta con un carro de carga y en ocasiones hace fletes al vecindario. Una de sus metas es ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante en sus estudios para que sean profesionales y asi mejorar la calidad de vida. Es una señora muy conocida y le va bien por el trato que le brinda a sus clientes. El crédito lo va invertir en comprar ganado. Es integrante del Banco Mujer Mujeres de Excelencia y se han caracterizado por su excelente comportamiento de pago y responsabilidad con la Fundación.  Junto con ella hay tres socias más que se unen y organizan para lograr fines en común. Van a invertir en ganadería y agricultura.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a woman of 41 years of age. She is the mother of three children, one adult and two minors. She lives in free union with her partner. Several years ago IDA, now INDER, granted her a parcel of land in the community of Aguas Frias.

She is a very hard-working woman with great desires to achieve. For this reason she is looking for financing to grow in her agricultural activities. She raises animals and works in agriculture. She has cattle to fatten, and she sells them at the auction. She also sells milk in the community, and she buys coconuts and resells them chilled. She raises bananas and yucca. She does everything with the help of her partner, given that this is the principal source of money for the household, because the sources of employment are minimal. She has a vehicle for transport and sometimes hauls freight in the neighborhood.

One of her goals is to help her children get ahead in their education so that they can be professionals and thus improve their quality of life. She is a very well known woman, and [her business] is going well for her because of the treatment she offers her customers.

She is going to invest the loan in buying cattle. She is a member of the Mujeres de Excelencia [Women of Excellence] communal bank, and they have been characterized by their excellent payment performance and responsibility with the foundation.

Along with her are three more members who united and organized themselves to achieve common goals. They are going to invest in livestock-raising and agriculture.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Tursunjon

texts.ru:
Турсунчон позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова и имеет двоих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Турсунчон мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Турсунчон выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Турсунчон никогда не сидит без дела. Она старается делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Турсунчон  начала свой бизнес. Она занимаются животноводством. Турсунчон выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Турсунчон получает хороший доход. Её доход хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у неё недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Турсунчон хочет купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Турсунчон заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Tursunjon is a positive and hardworking woman.  She is a widow and the mother of two children.  She lives in a small village in the countryside.  Since her childhood, she had always wanted to become a school teacher, but difficult financial circumstances within her family did not allow her to pursue a higher education.  Instead, she got married as soon a she finished secondary school and she became a home-maker.  In spite of the fact that she stays at home, Tursunjon is never idle; she always tries to do whatever she can to provide her children with all the necessities of life.

In order to have a stable source of income to feed her family, Tursunjon has started her own animal husbandry business.  She raises livestock and then resells meat and milk.  Thanks to this activity, she makes a decent income, which is enough for an average standard of living, but she doesn't have enough money to cover all of her family's needs.  At the moment, she wants to buy a few additional head of livestock for fattening.  For this reason, she has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and requested a loan to buy livestock.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support, as it will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлуда позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Мавлуда мечтала стать врачом, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Мавлуду выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Мавлуда никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.
Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Мавлуда вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Мавлуда выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Мавлуда получает хороший доход. Муж Мавлуды также работает в местной мастерской и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Мавлуда с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Мавлуда заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a positive and hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of two children. She lives in a small village in the countryside. Since her childhood, she had always wanted to become a doctor, but difficult financial circumstances within her family did not allow her to pursue a higher education. Instead, she got married as soon a she finished secondary school and she became a home-maker. In spite of the fact that she stays at home, Mavluda is never idle; she and her husband always try to do whatever they can to provide their children with all the necessities of life.

In order to have a stable source of income to feed the family, Mavluda and her husband have started their own animal husbandry business. Mavluda raises livestock and then sells meat and milk. Thanks to this activity, she makes a decent income.  Her husband also works in a local workshop and his job brings an additional income home.  Their combined earnings are sufficient for an average standard of living, but they still don't have enough money to cover all their needs. At the moment, Mavluda and her husband want to buy a few additional head of livestock for fattening. For this reason, she has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and requested a loan to buy livestock. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support, as it will improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en:
Sokny’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokny makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin continua trabajando y luchando para poder dar a su familia una buena vida, el continua trabajando con su taxi, y también su esposa lo ayuda con su trabajo de ventas. él comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder construir un salón para que su esposa siga con sus ventas de mercería, lo cual ayudo mucho a la económica familiar.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder arreglar el taxi que tiene, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Fermin continues to work and fight to be able to give his family a good life. He continues working with his taxi, and his wife also helps by working in sales. He comments that he used his previous loan to build a room for his wife to with her sales of sewing supplies, which has been very helpful for the family income.

Today, he is requesting this loan to repair his taxi, so that he can continue with his work and continue helping his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 22 years old and single. He has a motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for the last five years.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he is successfully repaying his previous loan. He will use the loan to repair his motorcycle, and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to improve his living standards. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan. In the future, he hopes to buy another motorcycle and expand his business.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Exequila

texts.en:
Exequila works hard to support her family. Exequila is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Exequila requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Exequila has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Exequila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Soy’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Soy makes a living cultivating rice, and does extra work as a factory laborer and tailor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Savern's Group

texts.en:
Savern’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Savern makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory labourer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as saving time needed to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoos, snack foods, drinks, etc.

Gemma has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns an income from fish vending.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, and spices.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 43 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijas adolescentes y estudiantes. Aprendió el oficio de costura de sus hermanas que se dedican a eso;  Su experiencia la adquiere trabajando en fábricas manufactureras por más de cinco años, cuando estás empresas cerraron trabajó también como demostradora para una empresa de productos de cuidado personal.  Luego de algunos de años y ante la enfermedad de una de sus hijas, se vio obligada a dejar de laborar para estar más tiempo con ellas. Al mismo tiempo empezó a capacitarse en diferentes áreas, graduándose en cursos de plantas medicinales y hierbas en el INA, además de otros cursos de gestión empresarial. Con estos conocimientos y los contantes padecimientos de una de sus hijas, empezó a confeccionar las primeras compresas terapéuticas para uso exclusivo de su familia, al constatar los efectos positivos decidió elaborar las compresas para vender. Desde entonces y hace un año se ha dedicado de lleno a esta actividad, en la que ve la posibilidad de generar ingresos adicionales al hogar y estar siempre al pendiente de sus hijas. Los productos que tiene a disposición de los clientes son las compresas terapéuticas a base de hierbas medicinales y los cojines terapéuticos que ella misma confecciona.
Actualmente le compran sus compresas terapéuticas todo tipo de clientes, además de los masajistas, terapeutas y manicuristas ya que es una herramienta complementaria para ese tipo de profesión. Sus productos tienen mucha demanda por sus propiedades curativas, además de brindar alivio y comodidad. En este momento vende en La Unión, en el centro de Cartago, Turrialba, algunos barrios de San José y actualmente está incursionando en ferias para demostrar y vender sus productos. Hasta ahora no existe competencia en la misma comunidad  y sus productos han tenido muy buena aceptación por los efectos positivos que brindan. En cuanto a la fijación de precios de las compresas, son accesibles ya que la materia prima utilizada para la elaboración es de bajo costo, como las plantas medicinales. 
Doña Margarita trata de darle el mejor uso a todos los desechos, en el caso de los orgánicos, los utiliza de abono en la pequeña plantación de hierbas medicinales que esta iniciando en su casa. Con el material reciclable es entregado a empresas o instituciones educativas cercanas, además con los residuos de madera que le dona un taller de ebanistería confecciona cajas para empaque de las compresas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old. She is married and is the mother of two adolescent daughters who are students. She learned the trade of dressmaking from her sisters, who do this work. She acquired her experience working in manufacturing factories for more than five years. When these businesses closed, she also worked as a demonstrator for a personal care products business. After some years, and faced with the illness of one of her daughters, she felt obliged to stop working to spend more time with them. At the same time, she began to train herself in different areas, graduating from courses on medicinal plants and herbs in the INA, in addition to other courses in business management.

With this knowledge and the constant illnesses of one of her daughters, she began to make the first therapeutic compresses for exclusive use of her family. On confirming the positive effects, she decided to make the compresses to sell. Since then (one year ago), she has devoted herself to this business, in which she sees the possibility of generating additional income for the household and always looking after her daughters. The products that she has available for her customers are the therapeutic compresses based on herbal medicines and the therapeutic cushions that she herself makes.

Now all types of customers buy her therapeutic compresses from her, in addition to massage therapists, physiotherapists, and manicurists, since it is a complementary tool for this type of profession. Her products have much demand because of their curative properties, in addition to offering relief and comfort. At this time she sells in La Unión, in the center of Cartago, Turrialba, and some neighborhoods of San José, and now she is making incursions into the fairs to show and sell her products.

Up to now there is no competition in the same community, and her products have had very good acceptance because of the positive benefits that they offer. With regard to setting the prices of the compresses, they are affordable, since the basic material used to make them is of low cost, such as the medicinal plants.

Doña Margarita tries to give the best use to all the garbage. In the case of the organics, she uses them for compost in the little plantation for herbal medicines that she is beginning at her house. The recyclable material is turned over to businesses or nearby educational institutions. In addition, she makes boxes for packing the compresses with the wood scraps that a cabinet shop gives her.

loans.use: to buy machinery and basic materials.

loans.name: Miante

texts.fr: Miante, 41 ans, est divorcée. Elle a deux enfants qui vont  à l’école. Pour prendre soin de ses enfants, elle s’est décidée à créer une activité capable de générer de revenus. Commerçante très dévouée, elle revend des produits alimentaires. Cette activité lui permet non seulement de donner à manger à sa famille, mais aussi à faire un peu d’économie pour les cas imprévus.
texts.en: Miante is 41 and divorced.  She has two children who both attend school.  In order to take care of her children, she has decided to start an income-generating activity.  She now resells food products and she is a devoted retailer.  Thanks to her business, Miante is able to feed her family and she can also save a little money in case of some unforeseen event.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sweets.

loans.name: Ermitaño

texts.es:
Ermitaño con 40 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos,en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Ermitaño cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ermitaño se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 10 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y inversión en el mantenimiento de su finca.De esta manera con el manteniendo de sus fincas obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Ermitaño es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ermitaño is 40 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his spouse and two children, in the Callayuc District, Cutervo Province, Cajamarca Department, in Peru. Ermitaño has many good references, both personal and professional, among the inhabitants of the region.

The people in the area mostly work in agriculture, business and with livestock. Ermitaño works in agriculture, specifically by cultivating coffee, where he has 10 years' experience. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farm. This way, with the maintenance of his farms he will get higher yields.

Ermitaño is a reactivated member of Field Partner Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: for the purchase of fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Basnewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIE  est la responsable du groupe BASNEWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11 ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charges.
Mme est vendeuse de fruits et légumes depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de l'aéroport.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte  acheter 02 caisses de bananes, 01 carton de pommes et 02 caisses d’orange.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie is the representative of the BASNEWENDE group.  She is married and the mother of three children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 11 and the youngest is 6.  Marie has three persons under her care.

Marie has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past four years.  She stocks up at the airport's market.  She will use her loan to buy two crates of bananas, one box of apples and two crates of oranges.  She wants to use the profits from her loan to save some money.  Her dream is to expand her activity and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two crates of bananas, one box of apples and two crates of oranges.

loans.name: Rayiimsoom Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est le représentant du groupe RAYIMSOOM. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 27 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il a 12 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est vendeur de pièces détachées et aussi mécanicien depuis 06 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Il  veut s’acheter 10 pneus, 10 chambres à air, 10 chaines à moteur.
Monsieur veut renforcer ses activités. Il ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yacouba is the representative of the RAYIIMSOOM group.  He is doing very well.  He is married and the father of seven children.  His oldest child is 27 and the youngest is 7.  Three of his children are in school.  Yacouba has a total of 12 persons in his care.

Yacouba has been selling spare parts and working as a mechanic for the past six years.  He stocks up in surrounding markets.  He wants to buy 10 tires, 10 inner tubes and 10 engine timing chains.  Yacouba wants to boost his activity.  His dream is to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to by 10 tires, 10 inner tubes and 10 engine timing chains.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Members of Savy’s Group live in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Savy makes a living by cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each group member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Choun's Group

texts.en:
Members of Choun’s Group live in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Choun makes a living by cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Samarng's Group

texts.en:
Members of Samarng’s Group live in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. Samarng makes a living by cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In the village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Sokly’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Sokly makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
Sreypov’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Sreypov makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and married with seven children. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as the above.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, biscuits, detergent soap, cereals, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Mao makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 44 years old and single with two children, one of whom is still in school. Ma. Theresa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, drinks, etc. She has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Ma. Theresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda’s husband is a fisherman. With great effort she helps her husband in this activity in order to have more financial stability. They have been doing this for seven years in order to provide for the needs of their family. They have six children - three who are now adults and three school-aged children.

Esmeralda’s dream is to improve their livelihood in order to have a better standard of living in the future. She also wants to have enough money to send her children to school and to finish a degree.

She is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy fishing nets and a fish trap.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a fish trap.

loans.name: Nakogbzanga Group

texts.fr:
Mr  KARIM est le  responsable du groupe NAKOGBZANGA.  Il  est marié et père de  04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18  ans et le moins âgé a 04  ans.  03 enfants  vont   à l’école et il a 04  personnes en charges.
IL fait du maraîchage  depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter  05  sacs  d’engrais  et  06 boîtes d’herbicides.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Karim is the representative of the Nakogbzanga Group. He is married and father to four children. The eldest is eighteen years old and the youngest is four years old. Three of his children attend school and he is responsible for a total of four people.

Karim has been growing vegetables for five years. He buys his supplies in the local villages and will buy five sacks of fertilizer and 6 boxes of herbicide with his loan.

Karim plans to reinvest his profits into his business and pay for schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of fertilizer and 6 boxes of herbicide.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Essi est une femme âgée de 34 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Essi est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Essi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs des riz de sucre en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises puis maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Essi is thirty-four years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells general food products. She buys new stock three times a month from the market and sells it from a stall in front of her house.

Essi has requested this loan to order sacks of rice and sugar to increase her sales and profit levels. This will help her husband to provide for the education of their children and pay for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of rice and 2 sacks of sugar.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Jose está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, al mismo tiempo ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio para que cada una pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus respectivas familias.
Sirley es una de las integrantes de este grupo ella se dedica a hacer comidas de todo tipo, que prepara cada día desde muy tempranas horas, y después sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio. Comenta que ya tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compra de ella las delicias que vende, y a través de ello tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, panificados, hortalizas, condimentos y otros, y de esa manera seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named San Jose is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. At the same time, they are participating in the poverty elimination program as a way of improving their living conditions and those of their respective families.

Sirley is one of the members of this group who earns her living by preparing food of all types. She begins her preparations in the early morning hours and then sells the food by traveling through her neighborhood. Sirley says that she has a well-definied clientele who always buy the delicious food that she sells. This gives her the means to provide her family a decent life without hardships.

Sirley is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing her food such as meat, vegetables, baked goods, greens, condiments, and other items. This will allow her to continue her work just as before.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, baked goods, greens, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dénise

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Dénise est une femme mariée habitant à Adidogomé. Ayant deux enfants à charge, Dénise est une revendeuse des tapis et torchons qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Dénise désire ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de tapis et de torchons en vue de bien vendre puis d’avoir des gains et contribuer aux charges de la famille en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès le début de cette rentrée scolaire.
texts.en:
Dénise is thirty-five years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and sells mats and kitchen cloths. She buys new stock twice a month from the market and sells it on foot in various neighbourhoods.

Dénise has requested this loan to order dozens of mats and kitchen cloths to increase her sales and profit levels. This will help her husband to provide for the education of their children for this school year, and pay for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 7 dozen mats and 5 dozen kitchen cloths.

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: Mariée, Victorine est une femme mariée de 46 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge à Adidogomè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Victorine est une revendeuse du bois de chauffe qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile puis réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Victorine désire ce crédit pour commander des tas de bois de chauffe en vue de mieux revendre afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Victorine is forty-six years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and sells firewood. She buys new stock twice a month from the market and makes a good living selling it from in front of her house.

Victorine has requested this loan to order several loads of firewood to increase her sales and profit levels. This will help her husband to provide for the education of their children and pay for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 20 loads of firewood.

loans.name: Yawa  E.

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée âgée de 35 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère de quatre enfants, Yawa est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Yawa désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Yawa compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is thirty-five years old, married and mother to four children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells general food products. She buys new stock once a month from the market and sells it from a shop in her house.

Yawa has requested this loan to order sacks of rice to increase her sales and profit levels. She plans to improve the range of products she offers for sale, improve the living standards of her family and provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA  est mariée et  mère de  04 enfants.  Le plus  âgé a 25 ans  et  le moins  âgé a 07 ans.  04  enfants  vont   à l’école et  elle a 06 personnes en charges.
Mme vend des pagnes et des chaussures  depuis  06 ans 06 mois. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter  40 douzaines  de chaussures,  et  07 pièces  de pagnes.
Elle veut  utiliser les bénéfices   du  prêt   pour aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne voyager et aller dans les pays extérieurs pour acheter ses marchandises
texts.en:
Aminata is married and has four children. The eldest is twenty-five years old and the youngest is seven years old. All four of her children are currently studying and she is responsible for a total of six people. She has been selling shoes and pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for six and a half years now. She buys her supplies from the markets in town.

Aminata plans to buy forty dozen pairs of shoes and seven pagnes with her loan. Her profits will be used to help her husband pay school fees for their children. Her ambition is to be able to travel abroad to buy her products.

loans.use: to buy 40 dozen pairs of shoes and 7 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 49 ans et mère de deux enfants, Abla est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé. Abla est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner, Abla demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de bien vendre puis d’épargner et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants et aider son mari à prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Abla is forty-nine years old, married and mother to two children. She lives in Adidogomé and sells charcoal. She buys new stock twice a month from the market and sells it from in front of her house.

Abla has requested this loan to order more sacks of charcoal to increase her sales and profit levels. This will help her husband to provide for the education of their children, pay for the day-to-day expenses of their family and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 32 años, es una socia emprendedora que saco adelante un pequeño negocio, ella se dedica a su taller de estructuras metálicas. Donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos como barandas, gradas, estantes, entre otros.
La socia  pertenece al banco “virgen Asunta “ tiene 2 hijos su deseo es sacarlos adelante con su negocio , por ello la socia solicito el préstamo para comprar soldadores, cierras y pintura. Para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y ampliar su negocio.
Yovana está muy contenta por el préstamo, ya que le ayudara mucho para conseguir sus metas, y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA por confiar en ella. Por eso se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Yovana, age 32, is an enterprising woman who is able to get ahead in her small business. She has a metal shop where she produces all types of items such as railings, stairways, shelves, and other products.

Yovana is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Asunta”. She has two children and wants to get ahead in her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy soldering irons, saws, and paint so that she can provide better service to her customers and expand her business.

Yovana is very content with the loan since it will be a great help in allowing her to pursue her goals. She thanks the Kiva lenders for trusting her. For this reason, she promises to complete her scheduled payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soldering irons, saws, and paint.

loans.name: Songtaaba Issa Group

texts.fr:
Mr ABDOU  est le  responsable du groupe SONGTAABA ISSA.  Il  est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04 ans et le moins âgé a 01 ans.  Aucun n’enfant ne va à l’école et il a 02 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du maraîchage depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son village.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 02 sacs d’engrais et 01 boîte d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abdou is the representative of the 'Songtaaba Issa' Group. He is married and has two children. The eldest is four years old and the youngest is one year old. Neither of his children yet attend school and he is responsible for both of them.

Abdou has been growing vegetables for five years. He buys his supplies at the market in his village. His loan will buy two sacks of fertilizer and one box of herbicide. Abdou will reinvest his profits into his business. In the future, he plans to pay for education for his children

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer and 1 box of herbicide.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Kuña Rory se llama este grupo, ellas se unieron para poder trabajar unidas y por medio de ese trabajo en equipo, y sumado al programa de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya, poder mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias.
Cada una de las integrantes lucha por sus seres queridos, para darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener, pero en especial se destaca el trabajo y la lucha de la señora Cristina, quien tiene una despensa, la que con sacrificio pudo montar y que con la ayuda de su familia y las capacitaciones que recibió ha podido mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder surtir su despensa y seguir de esa manera con sus ventas, quiere comprar bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su negocio a través de la cooperación de todas.
texts.en:
“Kuña Rory” is the name of this group. The members have joined together so that they can work as a team. By participating in the poverty elimination program offered by Fundación Paraguaya, they will be able to improve the living situation for their families.

All of the members strive on behalf of their loved ones so that they can provide them everything that they were not able to have. One individual who stands out for her work is Sra. Cristina, who owns a food pantry. Through sacrifice and with the help of her family, she was able to establish her business. The training she has received has helped her to improve.

Cristina is requesting a loan in order to buy products for restocking her food pantry so that she can continue her sales. She wants to buy beverages, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products. Cristina is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her business with the cooperation of everyone.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, who is in her late 30',s is a single with two kids, who are still in school. She has been selling clothes for two years now. She works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jane's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on her clothes stock and has managed to repay her loan successfully. She is doing great with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees for her two kids, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up to date clothes to meet her customers' requirement. Jane dreams is to open wholesale clothes shop.

Jane will be accountable for repaying her loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date clothes to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Daniela, a 40-year-old widow from Ormoc City, Leyte is into raising hogs for a living. Aside from this, she also sell dried fish. Daniela enjoyed what she is doing while also earning money, however she needs additional funds to keep her business going. She is asking a loan to buy sacks of feed, another piglets and packs of dried fish. Her earnings will be used to provide for her youngest child who is 14 years old and to buy food for family consumption.

loans.use: to buy feed, another piglets and packs of dried fish

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Hog raising is a business that is favorable to most women. Like Elena from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is 54 years old and she has been raising hogs for three years now. Her effort pays off every time she sell her hogs after every four months. Currently, she is struggling to maintain what her hogs need. She is asking a loan to buy feed to keep the animals well-fed and healthy. In the future, Elena dreamed of having a big and concrete barn to keep her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Semia

texts.en:
Semia is 41 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Semia is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Semia has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman, 56 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marlyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetable, spices, cooking oil, etc for her food production business.

Marlyn has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetable, spices, cooking oil, etc for her food production business

loans.name: Vima

texts.en:
Vima is 43 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vima has a general store business in the Philippines. Vima requested a PHP 28000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Vima has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Vima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Odtohan

texts.en:
Lanie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lanie is 37 years old and has one  child still in school.

Lanie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lanie requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lanie has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josefina dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Em makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 48 years old and has six children.  Amelita is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Amelita has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 43 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Arlene has a wood crafting business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 10 years. Arlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her wood crafting business.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 34 years old, married with two children.

Rio works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, drinks and etc.

Rio has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from e-load station.

Rio aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, snack foods, drinks and etc
